COMPETENCIES:
Functional/Technical Skills: Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment
Organization - Can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently; arranges information and files in a useful manner.
Time Management - Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values time; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities.
Informing - Provides the information people need to know to do their jobs and to feel good about being a member of the team, unit, and/or the organization; provides individuals information so that they can make accurate decisions; is timely with information.
Action Oriented - Action oriented and full of energy for the things he/she sees as challenging; not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning; seizes more opportunities than others.
Perseverance - Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.

2-3 years experience in business setting
Strong organizing, planning and time management skills.
Attention to detail
Proficient computer skills in MS Office Suite
Highly motivated and results oriented
Detail oriented with ability to break down projects into smaller tasks
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and projects.

The Southwest Florida Water Management District (District), a leader in protecting Florida’s water resources, is seeking a Data Analyst Student Intern in support of the Project Management Office (PMO). The Data Analyst Student Intern will be responsible for assisting PMO with statistical analysis, data collection, and other tasks associated with District projects and programs. The successful candidate will also be responsible for assisting with the processing and evaluation of data in the District’s project management information system (Daptiv PPM), and providing assistance to other sections within the Resource Management Division as needed. Tasks will include activities such as administrative processing, calculations, GIS processing, map creation, database entry and data collection.
Essential Functions
Compile data, perform appropriate analyses, developer produce reports, maintain databases, and prepare data for presentation
Assist with processing project manager and section manager requests
Assist in the evaluation of project management processes, project cost effectiveness of completed, existing, proposed, or potential District programs
Identify data gathered and analyze data flow for developing efficiencies, solutions, or alternative methods to improve data quality and data reporting
Maintain a positive and self-motivated attitude towards conducting data entry and developing tables and charts
Successful Candidate Must
Be enrolled at least part-time in an accredited college, university, or other recognized education or vocational program
Preferred Degrees: Business, Economics, Engineering, Environmental Science or Geology
Preferred Degree Level: Undergraduate
Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.5 for undergraduate students or minimum GPA of 3.0 for graduate students
Provide a copy of Official school transcript within 30 days of employment
Upload Unofficial Transcript to application or presence
Have the availability to work near the maximum allowable hours weekly
Working Conditions
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Most work is conducted in a standard office environment. This position requires the ability to perform continuous repetitive tasks (to include keyboarding) with one or both hands. Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 pounds. Must be able to operate a District vehicle for two hours or more at a time. May be exposed to extremes in temperature and humidity, as well as a variety of pests, including mosquitoes and ticks. Work environments vary by assigned business unit.
Additional Details
This position is typically scheduled to work no more than 25 hours per week between Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, out of the Brooksville, FL office. Schedule is contingent upon the decision of the hiring manager and the successful candidate. Student internship positions are not eligible for insured medical benefits.
Accepting applications until November 5 2019 at 4:00 PM
Compensation: $14.27 hourly, pay grade 104
Equal Employment Opportunity/Veterans Preference/Drug-Free Workplace/Tobacco Free Campuses
All applicants shall receive equal consideration and treatment in employment without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, sex, marital status, familial status, or medical condition. All recruitment, hiring, placements, transfers and promotions will be on the basis of individual skills, knowledge and abilities, and the feasibility of any necessary job accommodation(s).
The District participates in E-Verify employment eligibility verification. We will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

job_title: TEST DATA MANAGEMENT DATABASE CONSULTANT (CLASS TITLE: DATABASE ANALYST) - 76000216
summary:
Requisition No: 82572
Agency: Highway Safety and Motor Vehicle
Working Title: TEST DATA MANAGEMENT DATABASE CONSULTANT (CLASS TITLE: DATABASE ANALYST) - 76000216
Position Number: 76000216
Salary: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 Annually
Posting Closing Date: 11/02/2019

Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles
Division of Information Systems Administration
Bureau of Strategic Business Operations

*Open Competitive Opportunity*
**Pending Reclassification**

 In order to be considered for this position, applicant responses to qualifying questions must be clearly stated within the employment history. Software systems and actual work experience, years of employment, hours worked per week must be clearly defined, or the application may not be considered for the position.

TEST DATA MANAGEMENT DATABASE CONSULTANT (CLASS TITLE: DATA BASE ANALYST)
$40,000.00 - $50,000.00 Annually

Contact Person: Coretha Gaymon, (850) 617-2225

The Organization
The Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles (DHSMV) provide highway safety and security through excellence in service, education and enforcement. With a workforce of approximately 4,500 employees throughout the state, the Department is leading the way to A Safer Florida through the efficient and professional execution of its core mission: the issuance of driver licenses, vehicle tags and titles, and operation of the Florida Highway Patrol.
Our Benefits include
Annual and Sick Leave Package
Nine Paid Holidays
State Health and Life Insurance
Educational Benefits
Contributory Retirement Plan
To learn more about DHSMV and why it’s a great place to work, visit our website at: flhsmv.gov/careers.
What Will l I Be Doing?
This Test Data Management Data Base Analyst position functions as an integral member of the Test Data Management team and will operate as a database administrator for the department’s Oracle and SQL databases. The incumbent will perform database administration on Oracle versions 10g, 11g, and 12c. Duties will include: Assisting and supporting test data management, database and data warehouse users, analyzing, coordinating and implementing new database requests and systems; monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving test data management, database, and data warehouse issues.

Can I be successful? (Key Skills)
Knowledge, skills, and abilities, including utilization of equipment, required for the position
Experience in Oracle 10g, 11g and 12c database administration
Experience working in a Unix operating system
Ability to work independently and to resolve complex Oracle issues
Ability to effectively diagnose, isolate, and resolve complex problems about data infrastructure
Ability to write 10g/11g/ 12c SQL, PL/SQL, Stored Procedures, Functions, Packages and Database Triggers
Ability to Tune Oracle SQL and PL/SQL performance
Knowledge of Unix scripting
Knowledge of data synchronization and data synchronization tools
Knowledge of test data management and test data management tools
Experience in logical database design and data models
Experience as a PL/SQL Developer
Understanding of the software development lifecycle process
Practical experience in monitoring and tuning a database to provide a high availability service
Ability to maintain currency on tools, methodologies, and technologies related to data administration
Knowledge of data privacy and protection initiatives
Strong interpersonal skills to resolve problems in a professional manner
Ability to effectively communicate technical data processing information verbally and in writing
Ability to work well in a team environment, and to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others
Ability to receive and give constructive criticism, and maintain effective working relationships with others

Do I Qualify?
Do you have work experience administering Oracle and Oracle 12c databases?
Do you have work experience using the Oracle export/import or Data Pump utility?

Preference will be given to applicants with the following:
Professional experience writing stored procedures and PL/SQL programming
Experience as a PL/SQL Developer
Working with data synchronization tools

Education Preferred:
A bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited college/university in one of the computer sciences or management information systems (or)
A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university (or)
Completion of a two-year program of study from a vocational/technical school or accredited community college in an area of data processing (excluding data entry).


What’s Required?
A complete CJIS Level II Background Investigation is a condition of employment.
This position may periodically be required to work outside regular business hours.

Normal work hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m., although being on-call and working outside regular business hours may be required periodically.

General Information
The elements of the selection process may include a skill assessment and/or oral interview.
Applicants being considered for employment will be required to submit to a fingerprint-based background investigation, which will include a check of the criminal history records of the FBI.
The process for selecting applicant(s) for this position could take up to six months. Following the six-month period, a new application must be submitted to an open advertisement in order to be considered for that vacancy.
HSMV employees are paid once a month on the last workday of each month. All state employees are required to participate in the direct deposit program pursuant to s. 110.113 Florida Statutes.

The State of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer, and does not tolerate discrimination or violence in the workplace.
Candidates requiring a reasonable accommodation, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act, must notify the agency hiring authority and/or People First Service Center (1-866-663-4735). Notification to the hiring authority must be made in advance to allow sufficient time to provide the accommodation.
The State of Florida supports a Drug-Free workplace. All employees are subject to reasonable suspicion drug testing in accordance with Section 112.0455, F.S., Drug-Free Workplace Act.
VETERANS’ PREFERENCE. Pursuant to Chapter 295, Florida Statutes, candidates eligible for Veterans’ Preference will receive preference in employment for Career Service vacancies and are encouraged to apply. Candidates claiming Veterans’ Preference must attach supporting documentation with each submission that includes character of service (for example, DD Form 214 Member Copy #4) along with any other documentation as required by Rule 55A-7, Florida Administrative Code. Veterans’ Preference documentation requirements are available by clicking here. All documentation is due by the close of the vacancy announcement.

Nearest Major Market: Tallahassee

job_title: Data Management Analyst III - Health Outcomes and Biomedical Informatics (HOBI)
summary:
The Department of Health Outcomes and Biomedical Informatics (HOBI) participates in multiple Medicaid funded or related projects. Supporting State quality initiatives and conducting policy research using Medicaid and other health data sources. The incumbent in this position is part of a data management team responsible for data warehousing, management and analysis. They will design and manage data systems that include multi-sourced health, healthcare system, and social or population data sets. Analyses conducted will apply accepted principles and theories of the descriptive and inferential statistics and participation in interpretation and presentation of results is expected. This position may oversee statistical analyses conducted by graduate student research assistants and other staff. Communication of complex data and analyses to lay and industry audiences, in meetings and presentations and in written reports is required. Contributions to scientific reports, conference papers, and journal articles is expected.
Design and manage data file systems from multiple research projects that include multiple data sets using a variety of database and statistical software tools, for example, SAS, SQL, and Excel. Optimize transformation and transfer of data between projects and platforms. Provide expertise and communicate recommendations on data structures and appropriate use to project leadership. Interact effectively with internal and external data sharing partners.
Enhance data summary and reporting using various software tools including SAS programming, SQL code, Excel, Tableau, and application development tools. Suggest best practices for data and design improvements. Assist project leadership in representing information through data visualization and appropriate summarization.
Conduct statistical data analyses, write statistical programming code with SAS and SQL. Additional statistical software or programming tools including Python, R, etc. may also be used. Participate in interpretation of results. Provide statistical expertise to project leadership, or other research staff.
Participate in design, implementation, and reporting of research and evaluation studies. Contributions to scientific reports, conference papers and journal articles are expected, including documentation of method, presentation of data, and participation in interpretation of results.


Expected Salary: $75,000 - $82,000 annually; commensurate with education and experience.

Minimum Requirements:
Master's degree in an appropriate area and two years of relevant experience; or a bachelor's degree in an appropriate area and four years of relevant experience.


Preferred Qualifications:
Experience analyzing healthcare data

Diverse skills in data management, programming, and statistical methods; ability and experience working with a number of software packages (e.g., SAS, SQL, Tableau, R)


Special Instructions to Applicants:
For consideration, you must apply online. Please upload your cover letter of interest, resume, and three professional references.

The University of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to building a broadly diverse and inclusive faculty and staff.

This requisition has been reposted. Previous applicants are still under consideration and need not apply.

Application must be submitted by 11:55 p.m. (ET) of the posting end date.

Research Scientist
UPCI Research Lab-Oesterreich - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19007232)

The Womens Cancer Research Center is seeking an experienced Research Scientist to lead correlative science biospecimen clinical research activities and projects in a translational research laboratory setting. The incumbent will be responsible for research programs utilizing patient specimens (tumor and blood samples) and roles will include clinical sample receipt and tracking, processing and storage of biospecimens, analysis of biospecimens (DNA/RNA isolation, cfDNA/cfRNA extractions, immunohistochemistry, immunofluorescence, NGS coordination), and communication of results.

The incumbent will also play a key role in national breast cancer clinical trials initiated at the University of Pittsburgh and play a critical role in coordinating the correlative biology studies as part of the trials. Further, the incumbent will oversee all studies in the Lee Oesterreich lab which utilize human biospecimens and be a key point of contact for clinical collaborators and the institutional tissue bank. The experienced candidate must have exemplary communication skills, function in a highly collaborative manner and possess a superior attention to detail. Must be able to perform and trouble shoot complex laboratory procedures and optimize assays.

 Further, the incumbent is expected to assume supervisory responsibilities as part of research collaborations within the group and externally.

PhD – molecular biology or related discipline, with at least 3-5 years of experience working with biospecimens. PhD and relevant work experience necessary. The incumbent must be able to multitask, develop priorities, work in a fast-paced collaborative environment and adapt to changing needs. Experience in coordinating projects, working with clinical specimens and performing RNA/DNA analyses is highly preferred. Must have proven experience in mentoring and supervising junior lab members.

Research Scientist
Med-Aging Institute - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19003478)

The Aging Institute of the University of Pittsburgh and UPMC is seeking a highly skilled and highly motivated individual who will function as a research scientist to conceive and organize multiple projects. The incumbent will work closely with the lab PI, generating experiment plan and analyzing data. The current work mainly focuses on identifying ubiquitin E3 ligases that modify the aging process. The discoveries will lead to small molecule drug entrepreneurship development. This position is located at Bridgeside Point 1, 100 Technology Drive.

The incumbent must have a doctoral degree or a professional degree with license, and at least 5 years of post-graduate research experience in a relevant field of study. Technical expertise in molecular biology, cell biology, and biochemistry is required. Fundamental knowledge of genetics and aging is desirable. Small animal work experience is preferred. Previous publications are encouraged.

Department Details https://ai.dom.pitt.edu/

Research Scientist
Med-Pediatrics - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19004085)

This position is for a Research Scientist – Lab Track in the division of Medical Genetics. The primary role in the laboratory will be to design, conduct, and analyze studies with a focus on determining differences in brain imaging between affected patients and normal controls. The incumbent will be an active collaborator with the PI in the development and implementation of this research and will facilitate and coordinate all aspects of this project. Specific duties include developing and testing proposed methodologies and experimental protocols and take the initiative to actively develop protocols and collaborations to disseminate new technology.

A Doctoral degree (or professional degree / specialized technical training) is required with at least 3 years of post-graduate research experience (or an equivalent combination) in the related field of study. Experience in computer science, the electronic transfer of research images, pediatric brain imaging research, working with large research databases, bioinformatics, and able to independently obtain grant funding.

 This position is located at UPMC Children’s Hospital of Pittsburgh in Lawrenceville. TB test and PA Child Abuse History Clearance, PA State Police Criminal Record Check, and FBI Criminal Record Check will be required as a condition of employment. EEO/AA/M/F/Vets/Disabled.

Health Services Research Scientist
Med-Medicine - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19005727)

The Health Services Research Scientist will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of palliative research under the direction of the Principal Investigator/Director and will serve as a consultant for scientific research conducted within the Palliative Research Center (PaRC).
This includes, but is not limited to: drafting and submitting applications for funding, including NIH and foundation grants; developing or revising research methodologies used in PaRC scientific research projects; and first-authoring publications based on existing data from two large NCI-funded R01 grants. In addition, the Health Services Research Scientist will be expected to form and maintain key relationships throughout the University of Pittsburgh, the Hillman Cancer Center, and the palliative care research community nationally, identifying opportunities for collaboration and dissemination of research findings.

Finally, the Health Services Research Scientist will assume delegated responsibilities for the Principal Investigator/PaRC Director when she is not available. This position requires a doctoral degree with three years of research experience.

Must have experience with scientific writing and at least one first-author publication in a peer-reviewed journal based on original data.

It is an exciting time to join our team as we have recently added a third facility to ensure the continued ability to completely and efficiently manage our ongoing growth. This will allow us to support our current customers, who are in the top 25 pharmaceutical companies in the world, as well as our future customers! POSITION SUMMARY: The Reporting intern, under general supervision, will assist with all aspects of the report development lifecycle. The reporting intern will be mentored by reporting management and developers.

Employee Type: part-time

Schedule: Monday-Friday, 8:00am-4:00pm - during the summer (37.5 hours), flexible during the academic year (20 hours or less)

Starting Salary: $20/hour


DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES - Essential for this position:
Under general supervision, develop, code, test and validate enhancements to new and existing reports, views, meta-data and programs.
Works with other reporting analysts and business units to understand, communicate and resolve problems with reports, views and other data related structures.
Assists in development of reporting manuals, procedures and other documentation as needed.
Assists in research to develop or modify reports or reporting systems and/or software.
Documents reports and processes for the benefit of future users of the code and for the benefit of users of the report.
Provides security, integrity and validity to all credit union data.
Responsible for the ongoing maintenance of an effective systems of internal control within the scope of assigned job responsibilities.
Responsible for effectively managing risks within the scope of assigned job responsibilities.
DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES - Essential for all PSECU Management:
Attendance - Regular and consistent attendance is required to maintain acceptable performance standards and routine duties of the position within the normal operational guidelines of the unit.
Confidentiality - Confidentiality and document control is essential to this position to ensure member data is secure and protected from compromise.
Creditworthiness - Must meet creditworthiness.
Bondable - Must notify Human Resources in writing of conviction involving dishonesty, breach of trust or violation of the Pennsylvania Credit Union Code (17 Pa. S. C. A. 101 et seq.) during the course of employment with PSECU.


DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES - Non-essential:
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Responsible for supporting in-house programs.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND SENSORY ABILITIES:
Repetitive movement of hands and fingers, i.e., for typing or writing.
Lifting and carrying containers weighing as much as 20-30 pounds, i.e., to/from building and vehicle, to a storage area
Sitting for long periods of time, i.e., at a desk, in meetings.
Ability to reach above, at and below the waist.
Ability to reach above, at and below shoulder level.
Occasional bending, kneeling, stooping and/or squatting.
Visual acuity.
Auditory acuity.


OTHER:
This position may be advertised in the public media.
Appointment to this position is not subject to the terms of the Collective Bargaining Agreement.
Applicant may be required to complete one or more employment assessments and/or testing.
Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable a qualified individual with a disability or disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the job.

Minimum Experience:


College student pursuing degree in Information Technology, specializing in Analytics, Data Management or Programming with cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better.

UPMC is has an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Developer I for its downtown Pittsburgh location at the Heinz 57 Center. The Business Intelligence Developer I should possess analytical and programming capabilities, to develop and maintain reports and services using tools like SSRS and SSIS. The Business Intelligence Developer I will work with clients to define, analyze and document complex business and reporting requirements, and will perform analysis and data extraction/manipulation in an evolving data environment under the direction of senior analysts.

In addition to technical skills, this position will require business process analysis and interpersonal skills, and the ability to provide information consumable by senior business decision makers. He/she will also provide support for analytic activities to include: requirements gathering and data designs, development of analytic tools and reporting capabilities under the direction of senior analysts.

Responsibilities:

Assist Business Systems Analysts as necessary.
Complete ongoing, on-the-job training, through courses and self-study to maintain and enhance technical capabilities.
Develop and maintain reports and services using tools like SSMS and SSRS. Work with clients to define, analyze and document complex business and reporting requirements under the direction of senior analysts.
Evaluate and document client needs, including current processes and proposed revisions. Document requirements, define scope and objectives under the direction of senior analysts.
Maintain working relationships with business partners, professional peers, other team members, and external contacts as appropriate.
Meet deadlines and turnaround times set by managers and department director (these deadlines and turnaround times will, at times, require the employee to work until the project is completed, meaning extended daily work hours, extended work weeks, or both).
Possess analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and prepare standard and ad-hoc reports in a timely and meaningful way with attention to detail and accuracy with minimal supervision or direction from supervisor.
Responds to unfamiliar, undefined, or unexpected situations with a professionally prescribed standard response.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field (Mathematics, Economics, Health Care, Information Management or Statistics) is preferred, or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. Some advanced degrees may be considered in lieu of equivalent experience.
Minimum one year of relevant professional experience required in requirements gathering, analysis, design, database development or reporting analysis.
Demonstrate a high degree of professionalism, enthusiasm and initiative on a daily basis. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment a must.
Ability to support multiple tasks and projects, and forge strong interpersonal relationships within the department, with other departments, and with external audiences.
Attention to detail is critical to the success of this position, with demonstrated competency in customer orientation and the ability to deal with ambiguity.
Effective communication, documentation, organizational, analytical, and problem solving abilities.
Strong mathematical skills. Must possess a working knowledge of relational databases (SQL Server preferred), database structures, SSMS, and SSRS. Ability to interpret and summarize results of various analyses in a timely and meaningful way.
Ability to effectively approach problem solving. Must be flexible and willing to perform other tasks as assigned by the manager orsenior analysts.
Effective written and verbal communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate information to all levels within the organization.

Licensure, Certifications, and Clearances:
UPMC is an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Salary Range: $21.22 to $36.63 / hour

Union Position: No

Eurofins – Where extraordinary happens.
Interested in contributing globally to improving and saving lives? Beyond the tools and your team-mates, you will find inspiration in our innovative testing services that help make the world’s food, bio/pharmaceuticals and environment safer and healthier. Eurofins offers the complete career package.


Associate Data Review Scientist

Employee Responsibilities:

Ensure that the client receives quality data by reviewing laboratory data for accuracy, clarity, and adherence to GMP and/or GLP regulations
Review simple and complex routine and non-routine data (for three or more areas) according to departmental, corporate, and client SOPs; read and undestand analytical procedures; ensure all work is performed according to GLP/GMP requirements and apply GLP/GMP in all areas of responsibility as appropriate
Perform analysis of proteins and the impurities or raw materials associated with their production using various analytical techniques
Determine if data is compliant and defendable based on industry regulations and methodology
Verify data is of sound quality following all method, industry, and client requirements where applicable
Diagnose problems, solve simple problems, and suggest solutions to complex problems in professional area; perform complex calculations
Troubleshoot method and instrumentation problems
Use office and instrumentation specific computer software
Produce written reports (e.g., SOP, OMC, client reports)
The Ideal Candidate would possess:

Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills
Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude
Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies
Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in chemistry or other related degree concentration, or equivalent directly-related experience
Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship
What we offer:

Excellent full time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options
Life and disability insurance
401(k) with company match
Paid vacation and holidays
Come be extraordinary with us!
Position is full-time, Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm or Monday-Friday 3:00pm-11:00pm, with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, Pennsylvania are encouraged to apply.

Statistical Data Analyst
Med-Medicine - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19008376)

The Department of Medicine, Division of General Medicine is seeking a Statistical Data Analyst to join the Biostatistics Core of the Center for Research Healthcare (CRHC) Data Center.

The CRHC Data Center provides high-quality collaboration in biostatistics, data management and information sciences, and qualitative analyses, and has over 500 research projects in its portfolio. The Biostatistics Core supports researchers by providing expert consultation and direct assistance on research study design, data management, statistical analyses, report generation, and writing research articles and grant proposals. The Analyst will be supervised by senior-faculty statisticians, providing opportunities for mentoring, training, and professional development. The Analyst will assist faculty in designing and implementing appropriate methods for the management and analysis of complex research study data, manuscript preparation, and drafting statistical analyses and sample size sections of grant applications. The Analyst will also advise other CRHC staff on statistical programming issues.

The successful candidate must possess expertise in research methodology with emphasis on statistics or epidemiology, mastery of at least one statistical software (R, python, SAS, or Stata) and have strong interest to continuously learn new statistical methodology. The candidate must also be well-organized, efficient multi-tasker, possess outstanding communication skills, and able to work with a high level of autonomy.

Candidate must have a masters degree in statistics or related field with a high level of proficiency in a statistical package (R, python, SAS, or Stata). A combination of relevant experience, including academic internships, and education may be substituted for a masters degree.

Assignment Category Fulltime-Regular
Job Classification Staff.Systems/Programmer.IV
Campus Pittsburgh
Minimum Education Level Required Master's
Minimum Experience Level Required 5-6 years experience
Work Schedule Monday - Friday, 8:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.
Hiring Range $46,644.00 - $76,440.00
Relocation Offered No
Visa Sponsorship Provided No
Background Check For position finalists, employment with the University will require successful completion of a background check
Child Protection Clearances Not Applicable
Required Documents Resume
Optional Documents Cover Letter

Job Description

The Data Analyst is an employee of the Mayor’s Office of Education (MOE), who is responsible for data management, analysis, visualization and technical support. More specifically, the Data Analyst manages the data collection efforts and storage process by gathering multiple data sets from a variety of sources and combining them to build informative and comprehensive reports for various stakeholders. The Data Analyst supports ongoing projects by providing technical data expertise and engaging others to understand, develop, and use relevant data tools, processes, and methodologies. The Data Analyst is expected to take complicated problems and to build simple frameworks to help MOE staff and partners make better decisions. Data Analyst works under the supervision of the Data Manager.
Essential Functions
Data Management, Analytics, and Visualization
Pulls out and cleans data, analyzes it and communicates it to relevant stakeholders.
Uses data visualization tools and incorporates into relevant reports.
Creates and manages existing or recommended data tracking tools and/or systems
Assists in the preparation of and submission of relevant reports, as needed.
Assesses, tests, and implements new or data management processes and systems.
Technical Support and Evaluation
Provides technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Supports staff in the collection of data to meet reporting requirements.
Trains end users on utilization and interpretation of new reports and dashboards.
Supports needs assessments, monitor data collection analyze sources of disparate data streams.
Analyzes spatial data and designs digital maps using mapping software.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Qualifications (Education and Experience)
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics or Economics/Finance).
Experience using ArcGIS or QGIS, required.
Experience using Tableau, preferred.
Experience in version control and reproducibility (GitHub, GitLab, etc.), preferred.
Knowledge of the education system in Pennsylvania, preferred.
Must be comfortable with the use of data to drive decisions.
Competencies, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, Stata or R).
Experience with using data in an education, community, or social services setting.
Identifies and analyzes problems weighing the relevance and accuracy of available information.
Generates and evaluates alternative solutions and makes effective and timely decisions.
Ability to identify research questions and find answers independently using a methodological and logical approach.
Demonstrated ability to handle complex and multiple tasks in a professional and efficient manner.
Critical thinking and strong analytical and technical skills.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Must maintain a strict code of ethics in working with highly confidential data.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Additional Information

Salary Range: $55,000-$65,000
Interested applicants should submit a current resume and cover letter.

General Summary: The data analyst works as a member of the Assessment & Institutional Effectiveness (AIE) team and supports the Assessment and Program Review functions of the College. The data analyst will expand data availability in the college, playing a significant role in making sure that data and information produced is delivered accurately and efficiently. Will be responsible for retrieving and analyzing data from a variety of data sources in order to provide information and analyses for planning, assessment, accountability and performance improvements in areas across the college.
Requirements: Requires a bachelor's degree (master's preferred) in a Social Science field, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Data Analytics, Information Science, or another related field and a minimum of 3 years of experience working in a complex, deadline driven office environment, preferably in a higher education institutional research role, or closely related field. Must have a broad knowledge of institutional research methods, quantitative and qualitative data analysis, analytical computing, and higher education issues.

Proficient in the application and uses of statistical tools such as SPSS or SAS, and data analytics. Demonstrated ability to incorporate modern data visualization tools such as Tableau to analytic efforts highly desirable. Able to clean, debug, and analyze complex datasets that link data from a variety of sources and rapidly create ad hoc database queries utilizing modern desktop database tools such as SQL.Proficient in Microsoft Office software. Skill with survey research tools such as Survey Monkey is preferred. Understanding of ERP applications (Ellucian Colleague Student System) a plus.

Capable of working independently on complex assignments, collaborating with others, as well as the ability to maintain effective working relationships. Possesses strong time and project management skills. Able to present complex ideas, and analytic findings clearly and effectively, verbally and in writing. Familiarity with how community colleges provide access, respond to community needs, and provide equity is desirable.

Duties:
1. Utilize the Colleague ERP system and other database systems to analyze and interpret data.
2. Create visual analytic dashboards for internal clients within and across the College.
3. Create and maintain data visualizations to aid in the delivery and understanding of data.
4. Assist with the planning, design, management and support of colleges-wide data assessment tools and data warehouse initiatives
5. Provides support for faculty course and program assessment efforts.
6. Support the emerging institutional effectiveness paradigm with planning and decision making that is unit specific, but college-wide in nature.
7. Develop a working knowledge of college department data needs for reporting metrics such as student enrollment, retention and graduation rates.
8. Undertake survey research projects to meet the needs of a diverse group of campus entities.
9. Participate as a member of the AIE team to produce high quality institutional research reports.
10. Provide support for the college strategic planning process.
11. Provide support for and/or sit as a member of our Institutional Review Board.
12. Respond to ad hoc requests for information.
13. Serve on college committees to support college initiatives.
14. Perform other duties as required or as assigned.
Clearances: Current criminal record/child abuse clearances will be required if offered the position and in order to be employed at the College. The three clearances are Pennsylvania Child Abuse History Clearance, Pennsylvania State Police Criminal Records Check, and Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) Criminal Background Check. The College has provided instructions on how to obtain these clearances and are available here.

eCommerce Data Analyst
Peirce-Phelps, Inc. is currently accepting applications for a full-time eCommerce Data Analyst in our Blue Bell, PA headquarters location. We are looking for individuals who are eager to build a career and want an opportunity to play a key role in the eCommerce business of a well-established company. This position has great potential for growth as we ramp up our technical team to build a virtual online platform for our expanding customer base. You'll be working in a collaborative environment, with training support that will enhance your professional career.
Peirce-Phelps, Inc. is a privately-held, family-owned distributor of residential and commercial HVAC equipment, Building Automation Energy Management Systems and solid surface kitchen and bath products.
JOB DESCRIPTION: The eCommerce Data Analyst reports directly to VP of Technology Services and Solutions. The Technology Services and Solutions team is responsible for jointly building, maintaining, supporting, and enhancing our online capabilities and sales.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Acquire, maintain, and optimize product content from qualified sources used to drive customer experience online. Content to be managed includes attributes, images, specifications, descriptions, documents, metatags, and media links using Product Information Management PIM software system.
Define and optimize product taxonomy and category hierarchy classifications as selection evolves over time.
Manage intergration of product content from the PIM across other internal business systems, including ERP, eCommerce platform, and CRM systems.
Develop and maintain product marketing templates for web sites, emails, print catalogs, and promotional flyers.
Manage and support syndication of product content from the PIM to external content databases e.g. marketplaces.
Format data files to be imported and exported.
Collaborate with IT and establishing proper workflows, infrastructure and security.
Collaborate with Product Managers and Sales Teams to accomplish various marketing strategies and sales goals.

Bachelor's degree or higher in Business Information Management, or similar IT related subjects
1-3 years ETL data transformation and management, preferably with product data

1-3 years' experience working in a PIM, CMS and ERP.
Familiar with eCommerce platforms and ERP systems
Experience in supporting a business' digital presence on web & print
Excellent communications, writing and oral presentation skills
Desired Experience:
3-5 years experience in HVAC product data or other similar industrial equipment, parts and supplies
2-3 year working with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
Familiar with HTML and JavaScript
Experience in the design and layout of marketing materials
A self-starter, a successful candidate will have experience in managing themselves to success and finding their own path
Confident in their work, a successful candidate will be comfortable presenting their results to others including potentially company leadership
Candidate has demonstrated success working with or leading cross-functional teams
Candidate shows skill with prioritizing work independently to ensure that all objectives are accomplished
Candidate is a keen observer of the world around them, spots opportunities for new ideas and moves quickly to realize them

UPMC Health Plan has an exciting opportunity for a Data Curation Analyst - Senior in its HealthPlaNET Product Development department, located in downtown Pittsburgh at the Heinz 57 Center.

The Data Curation Analyst - Senior works within UPMC Health Plan's Population Health Management technology innovation division as part of a broad data, analytics and knowledge management team. The Analyst- Senior identifies and integrates new data sources/elements, and provides ongoing monitoring and maintenance of existing data sources.

Collectively, these data are a critical foundation that enable analytics and business intelligence assets to be delivered through proprietary organizational software systems. This curation requires creation of highly complex programming, data set infrastructure, and other advanced technical processes to integrate healthcare data elements from disparate sources throughout the UPMC enterprise and its partner organizations.

Responsibilities:

Adopt and promote best practices, tools, and methods set by team/department leadership.
Investigate data errors/variances and derive solutions with appropriate follow-up monitoring.
Maintain up-to-date information on status and effort related to each project.
Manage data, business rule definitions, and classifications for triggering clinical worklist creation.
Provide technical consultation and act as reference point to peers, other business areas, senior leadership and external customers.
Identify and define key data source dependencies for analytics and business intelligence assets.
Make recommendations for optimal data extraction, manipulation, and integration methodologies based upon research and analysis.
Meet deadlines and turnaround times set by supervisor. (These deadlines will, at times, require the employee to work until the project is completed, meaning extended daily work hours, extended work weeks, or both.)
Assist team leadership with distribution and monitoring of work assignments.
Work closely with software development teams to ensure connectivity and integrity of data assets for deployment.
Develop high-complexity integrated data sets to enable analysis, clinical operations, decision support, and refactoring of analytic assets.
Identify, implement, and maintain enhancements to clinical stratification processes.
Develop and maintain working relationships with internal UPMC health Plan departments, and external contacts as appropriate.
Perform validation and ensure quality standards for high-complexity data sets created by fellow team members.
Maintain policies and procedures of the team/department.
Coordinate ongoing communication with other departments in order to manage information integrity and maintain cross-department processes.
Assist with orientation and process-specific training of new staff members.
Qualifications
Minimum: Bachelor's degree in information systems, data management, healthcare management, business, or related field. Master's degree or other advanced degree preferred.
Experience: Minimum of three-to-five years of work experience in information technology, healthcare, business, or research is required. Five years is preferred.
Experience in health insurance or healthcare industry is preferred, but those with relevant experience in other industries may be considered.
Data and Technology Experience: Experience and high technical proficiency in SQL and/or SAS programming is required.
Experience with other programming languages used in data science (such as Python or R) is valuable. Extensive experience in other programming languages may be considered.
Extensive experience with extraction and manipulation of large, complex data sets is required.
Extensive experience managing/preparing data sets for use in analysis, modeling, or business operations is required.
Experience with Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel) is required.Experience with data visualization tools (such as PowerBI, Tableau, or QlikView) is highly preferred.
Experience with geo-mapping software (such as ArcGIS) is valuable.
Other Work Skills: Advanced problem-solving skills are required.
The ability to effectively communicate issues and results, verbally and in writing, is required.
The ability to use effective time management skills, including prioritization multiple tasks, is necessary for success.
Attention to detail is critically important in this role.
Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, ambiguous/fluid environment.
A strong customer/stakeholder focus is expected at all times.
Team player that displays professionalism at all times.
Ability to work extra hours if required.
Staff Management Skills: Experience in a supervisor role is preferred.

Data Analyst
Med-Biomedical Informatics - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19007790)

This Data Analyst will be a member of a research group in the Department of Biomedical Informatics (DBMI).
The successful applicant must be proficient with Python, Unix/Linux and have used software repositories such as Git and demonstrate familiarities with machine learning and statistics in particular, in order to work with a high level of autonomy. As a member of a team conducting novel biomedical research, a successful applicant will need to pre-process imaging data, run the pipeline developed by other members of the lab, and summarize the results. Detailed work with end-users and other researchers will be required, often with the implicit requirement of learning the details of a new and unfamiliar field.
Success in this position will require working closely with graduate students and postdocs. DBMI uses state-of-the-art software tools and systems to support cutting-edge biomedical research. DBMI is currently working on projects involving big data including large-scale electronic health record data, genomic data, information integration for personalized medicine, creating distributed research data networks, and related topics united under the common theme of translational informatics using information systems to move basic scientific insights into meaningful medical care. In addition, DBMI is the home to a large graduate training program in biomedical informatics.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or comparable field required. Experience with Python programming language; experience in additional languages (R, MATLAB) is a plus. Familiarity with one of the deep learning frameworks is a plus (PyTorch or Tensorflow). Experience with medical image data analysis is highly desirable. Familiarity with broad range of statistical methods such as parametric and non-parametric tests of significance, linear and logistic regression; some longitudinal analysis experience is desirable.

Clinical Data Analyst
Pharm-Pharmacy & Therapeutics - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (19007215)

The University of Pittsburgh School of Pharmacy Department of Pharmacy and Therapeutics is seeking a Data Analyst to apply data-mining, statistical, and modeling techniques to provide to support expanding research and clinical projects in the area of pharmacogenomics and precision medicine. The selected candidate will work under the supervision of Dr. Philip Empey in the Pharmacogenomics Center of Excellence and with teams in the Clinical Analytics at Clinical Analytics at UPMC.

 The Data Analyst designs, analyzes, and presents analytical solutions of large healthcare datasets to multidisciplinary teams summarizing population characteristics and outcomes to support data-based decision making to advance research and patient care initiatives. Specifically, to create analytic data files by using programming techniques to extract and aggregate raw data, conduct statistical analyses, ensure reporting logic is accurate, and document programming and results.

 The Clinical Data Analyst must ensure reporting logic is accurate and sound by comparing analytical output to data within the source systems, as well as through cross validation to base reports. Additional responsibilities include assisting with preparing methods and results sections of manuscripts and presentations, assisting with preparing preliminary data and methods sections of grant proposals, tracking of data assets, and helping to ensure compliance with institutional and federal regulations for human subjects research.

 The incumbent must demonstrate expertise in data management, SQL skills, and analytical, statistical or machine learning software packages (such as R, SQL Developer, SAS, or STATA). Experience with large health care or medication-related databases such as electronic health record or health systems data is highly desired. Candidate must be able to work independently and efficiently with a high level of scientific integrity and attention to detail in a fast-paced environment. Excellent interpersonal, problem-solving, and organizational skills and is expected to regularly collaborate with team members and see projects through to completion.

A Masters degree in mathematics, analytics, statistics, information systems, economics/finance, , computer science, healthcare management, or a related field is required. 3+ years of experience in data analytics is preferred.

Job Summary:
University of Pittsburgh Physicians is hiring a Clinical Data Analyst Senior to support the Anesthesiology Administration department during business hours on Monday through Friday.

Under the supervision of the Chief Analytics Officer, the Clinical Data Analyst Senior designs, analyzes and presents analytical solutions to multidisciplinary teams, including, but not limited to, physicians, administrators and organizational leaders, summarizing population characteristics and outcomes to support data-based decision making throughout the organization to improve elements such as patient care, clinical outcomes and operational throughput. Reporting specifications to be provided by requesting audience, and subsequently discussed within interdepartmental team meetings. Various clinical and administrative systems will be used as the data sources, including but not limited to Epic, Cerner and Medipac. Final aggregation and presentation will be completed through various software packages, including SQL Developer, Qlik and Cognos.

The Clinical Data Analyst, Senior must ensure reporting logic is accurate and sound by comparing analytical output to data within the source systems, as well as through cross validation to base reports under the direction of the Expert Clinical Data Analyst. The Clinical Data Analyst, Senior must be able to work both independently as well as in a team setting.

Responsibilities:
Stay abreast on new solutions relevant to the department through various webinars and intermittent conferences requiring brief travel
Develop and maintain working relationships with internal UPMC departments, and external contacts as appropriate.
Identify trends in outcomes, utilization, medical quality and other areas.
Maintain high level of accuracy and timeliness.
Effectively prioritize and complete all assigned tasks.
Exhibit advanced problem solving using various information sources.
Identify current /future data challenges, develop meaningful recommendations and provide timely updates on issues encountered.
Master new computer software programs and upgrades, as applicable.
Assist in organizing and leading discussions with multi-disciplinary teams, including but not limited to: senior management, department/division chiefs, chairs, physicians, etc.
Meet deadlines and turnaround times set by department (these deadlines and turnaround times will, at times, require the employee to work until the project is completed, meaning extended daily work hours, extended work weeks, or both).
Perform clinical analyses in a team oriented atmosphere and review the analytical outcomes to both clinical and non-clinical audiences
Interact with various clinical and non-clinical teams throughout each project to ensure data definitions and assumptions are accurate
Maintains patient confidentiality and ensures data accuracy.
Under the supervision of the Department of Anesthesiology and Perioperative Medicine Leadership, the Clinical Data Analyst designs, analyzes, maintains and presents analytical solutions for the Department of Anesthesiology and Perioperative Medicine and
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Biostatistics, engineering, health care management or a related field and five years of experience OR Master's degree or successful completion of the Financial Management Rotation program and three years of experience.
A degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related healthcare field is preferred.
MS Office proficiency required
SQL/Business Intelligence knowledge preferred (i.e. Qlik, Power BI)
Healthcare experience preferred
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills required
Must work well independently and within a team
Epic (UPMC's Electronic Medical Record) training is mandatory within the first year of employment, requiring one week of travel to Madison, Wisconsin.

About Us: Ahmic is a small aerospace research company specializing in high-performance instrumentation and measurement techniques. Our research portfolio targets many high-speed and high-enthalpy test environments including scramjet vehicles, propulsion systems, re-entry flight systems, space access vehicles, and material testing. Ahmic develops advanced instrumentation to transform the way aerospace test data is collected in challenging aerothermodynamic environments.Be Fearless. Be Ambitious. Position Description
 This position is responsible for applying machine learning and text analytics techniques for financial market analysis. The location is in DC, SEC headquarters. Onsite. Full time. Compensation $90K-150K/year (including bonus) + benefits. It is not a government job. It is a position of a private consulting firm but the client is the government agency SEC. Require Green Card or Citizenship. Public trust clearance is required before hiring.
Duties
 developing text analytics capabilities, and any related support, such as: developing and writing project-specific programs to process data sets using modern analytical methods, statistical modeling techniques, machine learning and statistical processes; analyzing and interpreting statistical data; computing supporting metrics; producing and maintaining models or other analytical products.
Qualifications
 shall have a minimum of a Master’s degree in computer science, statistics, or applied mathematics, and demonstrated experience of four (4) years in creating machine learning pipelines to derive insights from data (i.e., from data aggregation and cleaning, to using machine learning techniques). The key personnel should be familiar with unsupervised (e.g., clustering), semi-supervised (e.g., label propagation) and supervised learning (e.g., ensemble classifiers) algorithms, and when it is appropriate to use each. Knowledge of deep learning paradigms and architectures is a plus. The candidate shall provide resources that have deep experience in creating, managing, and analyzing large datasets. The candidate shall be familiar with contemporary scripting languages such as Python and R, the Hadoop computational ecosystem, Oracle relational databases, and the Linux/UNIX operating system.

 If you are interested in the position, please send us an email at contact@digitcompass.com with your resume and cover letter. Thank you!

Duties:
Conduct research and experiments to design, implement and refine our large-scale financial analytics warehouse and modern analytics platform. Develop new methods and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse sources of big data. Perform data mining using state-of-the-art methods including selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques, and processing, cleansing and verifying data for analysis. Analyze structured and unstructured data using Python and develop BI/Analytics solutions. Develop predictive models using R for statistical analysis and data visualization. Develop quantitative models using advanced mathematical, statistical and computational techniques.*This position qualifies for The Options Clearing Corporation’s Employee Referral Program
Education & Experience Required:
Master’s degree in computational physics, math or another quantitative field and one (1) year of experience as computational physics research assistant or data scientist.
Special Skills Required:
Must have experience with each of the following: 1. Developing quantitative models using advanced mathematical, statistical and computational techniques; 2. Developing predictive models using R for statistical analysis and data visualization; and 3. Analyzing structured and unstructured data using Python and developing BI/Analytics solutions.
Salary: $90,000.00 - 139,500.00
Apply: Apply online at www.theocc.com. No calls. EOE.

ABOUT US

One that challenges industry norms, embraces innovation and defines success by a different set of numbers: the numbers of lives touched, the number of lives changed, the number of lives saved. It’s a vision that we carry forward today. It’s at the very center of our culture. It’s who we are.

Duties

- Work alongside representatives from different clients to apply their data by designing and making suggestions for them to implement business models.

-Maintain detailed and accurate logistics data for daily, weekly, and quarterly reports including usage metrics, customer issues and resolutions, training records, work logs, and schedule documentation.

-Design processes and tools to allow data to be more accurate and more accessible.

-Perform market research to allow us to remain a relevant and constantly changing business.

-Provide assistance in the hiring process of new data team members.

-Support the rest of the data team and work together to get the most accurate measurements possible; teach others how to effectively apply the collected data.

-Collect, organize, and apply company statistic and general data in order to improve the efficiency and influence our company has; present the collected information in monthly board meetings to the heads of each department.

-Analyze business metrics and logic to submit suggestions for continuous improvements.

Benefit

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program, and the opportunity to advance your professional growth and career aspirations

Under the direction of the Director of the Business Intelligence Unit / Designee, responsible for providing operational database services to the Cook County Sheriff’s Office; ensures accuracy/integrity of data and applications through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution; analyzes and translates functional specifications and changes requests into technical specifications; develops, tests and implements program logic; translates business needs into end user applications; performs data analyst and modeling activities for a business-driven operational layer which integrates multiple master data domains and reference data and exposes the integrated data to enterprise wide applications via web services.
Key Responsibilities and Duties
Works with external agencies to integrate data into the Cook County Sheriff’s Office, maintaining and ensuring that data integrated into the Cook County Sheriff’s Office is normalized and accurate.
Collaborates with business stakeholders to understand and translate business requirements to E-R design and develop the CDM, LDM, and PDM; designs, creates and tests the database objects based on these models and designs data integrations for populating these databases.
Gathers end-user requirements for data dissemination and reporting.
Ensures that any new software integration into the organization systems meets
functional requirements, system compliance, and other specifications.
Builds test scripts to thoroughly test the accuracy and completeness of loaded data.
Performs production support activities as needed for this operational environment.
Collaborates with SMEs, Data Stewards, Business Stakeholders, the DBA team, the ETL development team and the Web Services development team to accomplish their goals.
Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in individual and group problem solving situations and effectively uses logic and reason.

Performs other related assignments and duties as directed.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Expertise with SQL, PL/SQL and/or T-SQL.
Familiarity with data warehouse design principles.
Experience developing dashboards and reports using at least one industry-leading reporting platform (Business Objects, Microstrategy, OBIEE, Cognos, SSRS, etc.).
Understanding of data governance principles and best practices.
Experience building integrations using at least one ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS, Datastage, etc.).
Ability to communicate effectively in the business environment, using tact and courtesy and use sound judgment in interpreting problems and issues related to work assignment.
Ability to create and prepare reports, including technical documentation, as required.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize, handling multiple projects and meeting deadlines while effectively managing changing priorities, as needed.
Ability to troubleshoot by analyzing data and situations, reason logically and creatively, identify problems, draw valid conclusions and develop effective solutions.
Ability to effectively handle stressful situations and meet prescribed deadlines.
Ability to adapt to a structured environment, following necessary techniques and procedures.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and leadership and to supervise and lead others.
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Thorough working knowledge of or ability to quickly and effectively grasp and utilize the policies, protocols, systems, procedures, and technical vernacular of the agency, department and County, as they are applicable to assigned duties and responsibilities.
Ability to effectively participate in staff meetings or other forums aimed at developing constructive ideas, observations, audit findings and recommendations.
Skill in interacting with others to investigate, gather and review confidential materials, information and incidents of record.
Ability and willingness to participate in development and training programs in order to upgrade skills and knowledge.
Ability to travel to work assignments by providing own means of transportation.


Minimum Qualifications
Possession of a Bachelor's degree in IT related discipline, from an accredited college or university, AND/OR seven (7) or more years of full time, development experience with ETL tools (Data Stage, Informatica etc.) and BI reporting tools (Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, others).

Possession of a valid Driver's License and proof of vehicle insurance, with the ability to operate a motor vehicle.
Seven (7) or more years combined professional work experience working with multiple key relational database management system (RDBMS) platforms and related tools such as SQL Server.

Seven (7) or more years of professional work experience in creating Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD) Models and Logical and Physical Models, obtained within the last seven (7) years.

Ability to work any shift assigned, including days, afternoons or midnights; must be capable of working Holidays and weekends; must be capable of working mandatory overtime, as required.
Preferred Qualifications
Possession of ITIL Foundation Certification.
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE): Data Platform or Business Intelligence.
Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA): SQL Server 2008 R2 or higher.

Full-time Support Staff

The Data Center Analyst reports to the Senior Data Center Manager and supports all college data center data analysis functions.

Responsibilities
Provide support for servers hardware and software application technologies.

Install, configure and maintain server builds and deployments.

Test and install new and old server Operating Systems.

Assist short- and long-term plans for data center infrastructure design.

Design, develop, implement and manage campus servers and storage systems.

Manage and troubleshoot inter- and intra-net hardware, software and connectivity.

Manage, maintain and troubleshoot issues with servers, storage, applications and integration with other IT systems.

Participate in planning for growth in multi-site environment.

Implement and maintain security and management software.

Maintain and support college Windows, Mac and Linux server environments.

Maintain and support virtual server and desktop environment.

Maintain and support the storage area network.

Perform other duties as assigned by the Data Center Manager.
Minimum Qualifications
Associate degree in Computer Technology or related field. Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
Three years experience in a large data center environment required.
Competency with multiple operating systems, software and related hardware.
Competency with Linux, Mac and Windows operating systems and related hardware.
Comprehensive knowledge of VMWare.
Knowledge of Internet connectivity including LAN/WAN systems and software installation.
Working knowledge of Zenworks or SCCS desired.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to self-direct and work effectively interpersonally as well as technically.
Ability to work off hours and be on call for support based on a rotating schedule.

Cover Letter-Yes
 Resume-Yes
References-Yes (May be provided at interview)
Transcripts-Yes(May be provided at interview)

Responsible for tracking and analyzing quality data that supports quality management functions to aid in safety, quality, and performance improvement projects. Through the use of a variety of reporting sources, the Quality Services Data Analyst will utilize analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills to fulfill internal and external data reporting needs. This position supports the development of standard departmental reporting for operational planning; independently formulates methodologies to achieve results; coordinates the ongoing assessment and monitoring of clinical and operational outcomes. Business knowledge is applied to data output and analyses to identify trends, anomalies, and to facilitate process improvement as needed. Acts as a strategic resource for analyzing external data and reports in order to facilitate broader understanding of current and projected future performance for executive leadership strategic planning. Interprets and summarizes external technical specifications to provide internal stakeholders with pertinent information regarding requirements and potential impact to the organization and facilitate internal tracking of relevant data to promote performance improvement.
Improve quality and infection prevention data efficiencies to make data readily available for improvement opportunities to be shared with quality staff, committees, practitioners, clinical staff, and leadership.
Participate in Quality Services projects and tasks to promote efficient use of resources, identify and recommend action to improve and fix data operations and processes.
Collaborate with performance improvement teams and quality committees both internal and external to the department to provide technology expertise, gather and analyze data; include technical specifications alignment and ensure data quality integrity. Must take appropriate steps to ensure data sources and output are accurate.
Manage data gathering and timely submission of data for regulatory reporting and benchmarking purposes (e.g. Merit-based incentive Payment Systems reporting, Inpatient Quality Reporting, etc.).
Incorporate quality, infection prevention, performance improvement and patient safety principles into assigned activities and workflow.
Communicate information from primary and secondary quality metrics to committees, clinical staff, practitioners and non-physician leadership to aid in the process of quality strategy development, decision making, and process improvement.
Coordinate, gather, and alayze data from internal and external surveys related to quality and patient safety.
Develop and maintain advanced knowledge of various data and regulatory reporting areas, programs and databases in order to serve as a subject matter expert.
Utilize databases and/or software to generate routine and special request reports as requested/required. Coordinate and support audits, collect statistical data and analyze routine and special data for variances and/or opportunites to improve outcomes.
Analyze data with statistical methods, interpreting the results, providing a written summary of data analyses in order to identify and promote performance improvement.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications to ensure accuracy and integrity of data.
Validate source data to ensure accuracy and alignment with internal and/or regulatory measure specificiations.
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Bachelors Health Information Management or Bachelors Computer Science Bachelors Related Field or Master's degree preferred.


CERTIFICATION & LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS

Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ) preferred.


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

Minimum of three (3) years of relevant reporting experience with Master's degree OR five (5) years of relevant reporting experience with Bachelor's degree. Reporting, information technology, or data and operations management experience. Experience with clinical audits/data abstraction, electronic health records, and other sources of clinical data preferred.


OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Advanced computer skills, including Windows-based applications (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook, etc.), other online collaborative tools, and reporting tools (e.g. Access, SQL server tools, SQL Business Intelligence Tools). Highly developed ability to identify, research, analyze, and develop innovative ways to streamline work flow and data processes. Advanced analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills with a proven ability to interpret data, identify trends, and anomalies. Understanding of databases, query language, and concepts. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to learn and adapt to change in order to further department and organizational goals. Proficient aptitude to plan, prioritize, coordinate, and complete projects by specified deadlines with a high level of quality, accuracy and clarity. Must be self-motivated and able to work independently. Must be detail oriented with critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

summary:
Position Description
 This position is responsible for liquidity risk analysis and financial market analysis. The location is in DC, SEC headquarters. Onsite. Full time. Compensation $140K-200K/year (including bonus) + benefits. It is not a government job. It is a position of a private consulting firm but the client is the government agency SEC. Require Green Card or Citizenship. Public trust clearance is required before hiring.
Duties
 performing financial analysis and building advanced financial models to analyze security market data and assess the liquidity of the assets and portfolios. performing analysis of the financial markets, securities, and related financial data. processing financial data and managing databases;
Qualifications

 shall have a minimum of 7 years data analysis experience in capital markets/financial industry or economic analysis, with deep expertise in financial market-related topics such as hedge funds, options, credit default swaps, mortgage backed securities, or municipal securities. The Capital Markets and Financial Industry Data Analyst shall have knowledge of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, computer software and algorithms that are commonly applied in these areas. A Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, or Mathematics is essential. An MBA or MFE is desired. The candidate shall demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively with financial economists, or other quantitative analysts and programmers and possess a broad knowledge of hardware/software technologies.

 If you are interested in the position, please send us an email at contact@digitcompass.com with your resume and cover letter. Thank you!
