ABOUT DTA


The Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) assists and empowers low-income individuals and families to meet their basic needs, improve their quality of life, and achieve long term economic self-sufficiency. DTA serves one in eight residents of the Commonwealth with direct economic assistance (cash benefits) and food assistance (SNAP benefits), as well as workforce training opportunities.

This is a provisional appointment.

POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking qualified applicants for the position of Data Analyst. The duties for this position will include but are not limited to:
Assist with the development and implementation of various monitoring reports for DTA Management. Performs on-demand report generation, ad-hoc queries and analytic tasks.
Design and implement qualitative and quantitative data collection processes to support the Office of Budget and Policy Analytics.
Extract data using TOAD, Cognos Analytics, and Tableau to provide data and data analysis for internal and external stakeholders.
Take in data requests from senior level staff and translate them to technical design requirements.
Develop systems and strategies for utilizing internal and external databases and other data sources for policy, program and procedure evaluation.
Deconstruct and evaluate current Agency functions and recommend, implement and evaluate changes by generating analytic reports.
End to end validation using Oracle SQL and Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, aggregate functions, IF statements) to ensure comprehensive data integrity.
Complete in-depth, complex data analysis from varied datasets to develop a thorough understanding of extracted data. Deduce meaning of the analysis and distribute the information back to senior level staff. Identify trends and patterns that can inform predictive analytics.
Design, manage, produce, and regularly maintain and present policy and program performance management reports which evaluate the organization’s progress against specific goals and targets.
Create efficiencies by utilizing automated reporting via Cognos Analytics and query tools to support multiple business areas’ need for operational metrics and statistics.
Research local state and national data and programs to make recommendations for improvements to Agency processes.
Ability to write and revise complex SQL queries using optimization design patterns to minimize negative impact to database resources.
Assume independent responsibility for tasks given to the analyst by their manager. Ability to research and understand previously unknown subject matter to accomplish the task.
Develop and portray data visualizations using Tableau to help see trends and draw conclusions and inform senior level management on past and future events.
Load external datasets into the data warehouse to establish unique relational matches with BEACON data to develop previously unknown data insights.
Develop and present PowerPoint presentations as well as other visual reports.
Works with Project Management team serving as the major contributor and project lead for the DTA agency dashboard.
Identify, evaluate and disseminate best practices among Agency stakeholders;
Provide technical assistance to Agency Management and staff on data collection, systems and reporting.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned or requested.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge and expertise in practical statistical sampling theory and application, data collection and analysis methodologies, and electronic data processing applications.
Knowledge of statistical software to conduct various analysis
Knowledge of federal and state laws and regulations governing the functions of the agency.
Ability to analyze and determine the applicability of data, draw meaningful conclusions and make appropriate recommendations.
Ability to promote and support data improvement, innovation, communication and integration efforts.
Knowledge of Performance Management with the ability to design and implement data collection, research, evaluation, quality management and accountability processes.
Ability to distill complex data into succinct reports (in a manner appropriate and comprehensible to various audiences) leading to conclusions, recommendations and/or action items.
Knowledge of project management theory and practice with the ability to design and manage process for coordinating the prioritization of projects; ability to track the progress of each project and identify project improvement opportunities and strategies.
Skilled in problem solving, consensus building and team building with the ability to manage a number of projects simultaneously to successful completion.
Knowledge of dashboard creation and production.
Knowledge of program improvement, innovation and integration strategies.
Ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Ability to communicate in writing and orally with superiors and subordinates, with the public and state officials.
Ability to mediate conflicts, coordinate competing interests, work under time constraints, and adjust to varying or changing situations to meet emergency or changing program requirements.
Ability to exercise discretion in handling confidential information.
Ability to exercise sound judgment.


Pre-Hire Process:

A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori and click on "Information for Job Applicants".

Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines.

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions, please contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.

Qualifications

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.


MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS: Applicants must have at least (A) four years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in work simplification, management analysis, program analysis, methods analysis, economic analysis, fiscal analysis, financial analysis, budget analysis, program administration, or program management or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.


Substitutions:

I. A Bachelor's degree with a major in business administration, business management, public administration, industrial engineering or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required experience.*


II. A Graduate degree with a major in business administration, budget management, public administration, industrial engineering or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of three years of the required experience.*


III. A Bachelor's degree or higher degree with a major other than in business administration, business management, public administration, industrial engineering or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required experience.*

Education toward such a degree will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.
NOTE: Educational substitutions will be permitted for a maximum of three years of the required experience.


An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

job_title: Data Solutions Analyst / Sr Data Solutions Analyst
summary:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance- A Fortune 100 Company!

Do you want to leverage your creative and technical skills in a business environment? Do you have an eye for design? Want to be part of an innovative culture? Are you looking for a position with potential for growth and advancement? If any of these apply to you – come join our team!

As a Business Intelligence analyst and developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining business intelligence solutions to support key strategic and operational initiatives within Liberty Mutual’s Business Lines Distribution & Service Insights organization. This position will require working collaboratively with technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure end-user needs for business intelligence solutions are met.

This is a range posting, meaning we can hire someone as either a Data Solutions Analyst or a Sr. Data Solutions Analyst depending on skills and experience. The preferred office location is Boston MA with secondary office locations in Dover NH, Plano TX, Seattle, WA, Indianapolis, IN, Fairfield, OH or Wausau, WI. We are also open to a working remote scenario.
 Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain solutions that leverage Best-in-Class intelligence design capabilities
Assists in the design and development data solutions that enable effective self-service data consumption and can describe their value to the customer.
Improve accessibility to data via data aggregation, effective visualization and navigation improvements
Develop re-usable tools and assets to support automation, reporting and analytics initiatives
Produce accurate, consistent and timely visualizations by extracting information from various applications and systems, manipulating data and leveraging business intelligence tools to develop user-friendly outputs
Effectively source data into business intelligence tools to enable visualizations
Automate existing reporting and establish business intelligence best practices
Establish detailed documentation for all visualizations and technical solutions
Identify reporting and data processes that are inefficient and drive change that will lead to measurable gains in data quality and processing time
Work in partnership with other groups to develop automated visualizations in the most effective medium
Provide appropriate communication to stakeholders, including providing customer support for existing tools (ex: issues, questions, enhancements)
Conduct infrastructure design work efforts using a variety of analytical tools
Assists in the maintenance of proof-of-concepts and prototype solutions and assists in any assessment of their viability and scalability, with partnership from IT. Working with IT, assists in building robust systems focusing on long-term and ongoing maintenance and support.
Applies a basic knowledge of the principles of metadata, lineage, business definitions, compliance, and data security to project work.
Participate in special projects as required

Qualifications:
Strong written and oral communication skills required.
1-2 years’ experience in coding for data management, data warehousing, or other data environments, including, but not limited to, working in NoSQL implementation, ETL, Java, scripting languages (Python, Perl, Shell), and the Hadoop stack.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline preferred.
Master`s in same or related disciplines strongly preferred.
Knowledge of data architecture concepts, querying and data sourcing. Knowledge of SAS, MicroStrategy or similar database tools preferred
1+ years programming experience in at least 1 of the following: Java, Python, C++ or similar language preferred
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, HDFS, Map Reduce, Hive, Pig preferred. Highly developed negotiation, consensus building & influencing skills, facilitation and the adaptability to respond to change quickly. Ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization and work both as a member of an Agile team and independently as required
Effective analytical/problem solving and research skills
Ability to manage tasks/projects with aggressive deadlines/time-sensitivity

Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.

We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

TetraScience is a cloud-based, data integration company that provides the scientific community with centralized, standardized, and actionable scientific data to fuel innovation, facilitate collaboration and accelerate discovery.
The TetraScience Data Integration Platform automatically integrates, normalizes, and validates data from heterogeneous sources, thereby creating a centralized set of scientific data from which scientists can draw conclusions, gather insights, and take actions.
The Life Sciences Data Business Analyst's primary role is to understand scientific and data flows inside Life Sciences companies, implement, configure and develop TetraScience solutions.
In this role, you will work closely with our customers to understand their needs, analyze their data environment, assist in the design and implementation of our solutions and aid in integration with their data systems. You will also be responsible for demonstrations and training, technical support, and business development where appropriate. This is a highly customer-facing role and requires deep domain knowledge of one or more Chemistry/Biology domains including process development, analytical chemistry, CMC, antibody-drug discovery, protein production, in-vitro screening, assay development and etc.
TetraScience is the perfect place for you experience a vibrant software culture, leverage your domain expertise in Life Sciences and bring your career to the next level or direction! We have prepared multiple career opportunities for you as a domain expert from pharma/biotech industry!

Responsibilities
Investigate how to integrate with scientific instruments and software to extract data from the instrument.
Interact and build a relationship with the instrument and software vendors to acquire test licenses and documentation.
Design and maintain data models for common classes of the instrument, and CRO data sets; harmonize the vendor-specific or vendor proprietary terms into abstract terms in the data models.
Deeply understand the pharmaceutical and biotech scientific workflow and data flow, namely, how scientists use data systems (LIMS, ELN, integration&visualization tools, biologic registration tools) and how these data systems are developed, configured and eventually complement scientists lab workflows and allow them to access their data efficiently and effectively.
Design and create a specification for data flow, for example, the logic around validation, metadata extraction, integration with ELN/LIMS/sample management and other systems.
Install and configure the TetraScience Data Integration Platform.
Educate customers on the use and configuration of the Data Integration Platform.
Work effectively within a team, especially with software engineers, product managers, and marketing.
Work closely with the software development team to suggest and aid in future versions of the Data Integration Platform.
Other ad hoc duties as required.

Career Opportunities
After you gain experience in this role, you can grow your career in multiple exciting directions:
Solution Architect. In this role, you will
Work closely with the sales to understand Life Sciences companies’ need for data collection, data integration, data management, and data science
Design and architect the solution using TetraScience Data Integration Platform.
Create and negotiate Statement of Work

Perform pre-sales investigations and prototypes of data sources, data models
Product Management
Data Engineer / Scientist
Build data pipelines using Python and other scripting languages
Build report and dashboards using Spotfire, Tableau, Jupyter notebook and etc

job_title: Data Solutions Analyst / Sr Data Solutions Analyst
summary:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance- A Fortune 100 Company!

Do you want to leverage your creative and technical skills in a business environment? Do you have an eye for design? Want to be part of an innovative culture? Are you looking for a position with potential for growth and advancement? If any of these apply to you – come join our team!

As a Business Intelligence analyst and developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining business intelligence solutions to support key strategic and operational initiatives within Liberty Mutual’s Business Lines Distribution & Service Insights organization. This position will require working collaboratively with technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure end-user needs for business intelligence solutions are met.

This is a range posting, meaning we can hire someone as either a Data Solutions Analyst or a Sr. Data Solutions Analyst depending on skills and experience. The preferred office location is Boston MA with secondary office locations in Dover NH, Plano TX, Seattle, WA, Indianapolis, IN, Fairfield, OH or Wausau, WI. We are also open to a working remote scenario.
 Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain solutions that leverage Best-in-Class intelligence design capabilities
Assists in the design and development data solutions that enable effective self-service data consumption and can describe their value to the customer.
Improve accessibility to data via data aggregation, effective visualization and navigation improvements
Develop re-usable tools and assets to support automation, reporting and analytics initiatives
Produce accurate, consistent and timely visualizations by extracting information from various applications and systems, manipulating data and leveraging business intelligence tools to develop user-friendly outputs
Effectively source data into business intelligence tools to enable visualizations
Automate existing reporting and establish business intelligence best practices
Establish detailed documentation for all visualizations and technical solutions
Identify reporting and data processes that are inefficient and drive change that will lead to measurable gains in data quality and processing time
Work in partnership with other groups to develop automated visualizations in the most effective medium
Provide appropriate communication to stakeholders, including providing customer support for existing tools (ex: issues, questions, enhancements)
Conduct infrastructure design work efforts using a variety of analytical tools
Assists in the maintenance of proof-of-concepts and prototype solutions and assists in any assessment of their viability and scalability, with partnership from IT. Working with IT, assists in building robust systems focusing on long-term and ongoing maintenance and support.
Applies a basic knowledge of the principles of metadata, lineage, business definitions, compliance, and data security to project work.
Participate in special projects as required

Qualifications:
Strong written and oral communication skills required.
1-2 years’ experience in coding for data management, data warehousing, or other data environments, including, but not limited to, working in NoSQL implementation, ETL, Java, scripting languages (Python, Perl, Shell), and the Hadoop stack.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline preferred.
Master`s in same or related disciplines strongly preferred.
Knowledge of data architecture concepts, querying and data sourcing. Knowledge of SAS, MicroStrategy or similar database tools preferred
1+ years programming experience in at least 1 of the following: Java, Python, C++ or similar language preferred
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, HDFS, Map Reduce, Hive, Pig preferred. Highly developed negotiation, consensus building & influencing skills, facilitation and the adaptability to respond to change quickly. Ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization and work both as a member of an Agile team and independently as required
Effective analytical/problem solving and research skills
Ability to manage tasks/projects with aggressive deadlines/time-sensitivity

Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.

We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

NSMHA is looking for an early career Data Analyst for our Quality Management program! The Data Analyst must have experience working with large and complex sets of data, preferably in healthcare, and be detail oriented with strong analytical, communication, critical thinking and math skills. The Analyst will interact closely with internal and external managers/constituents to define projects and detailed analysis plans and reporting systems that will help guide business decisions. The Analyst will support the current SQL database system and will conduct research on software applications that would support the Agency to be more efficient with data and outcomes collection and reporting. The Analyst must possess very strong organizational skills, maintain excellent documentation, and have experience with interpreting and presenting data to senior and executive level managers
This position salary ranges from $50,000 to $60,000 depending on experience.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops and implements data collection process and reporting activities as part of continuous quality improvement.
Receives, stores, merges and cleans data sets of varying size and complexity, preparing data for analyses.
Works closely with the Directors of Accounts Payable and Applications and Data Management with reporting and analyzing data from the electronic health record and health care claims databases.
Works with clinical staff, administrators and managers to support the implementation of outcomes tools and quality reporting measures as required by state and federal funders.
Manages the data and reports related to staff productivity.
Provides detailed descriptions of analyses and findings for funding proposals, grants, compliance deliverables, and quality initiatives.
Facilitates, interprets and presents data to various levels of management.
Represents the Agency on external data-related workgroups or committees, as needed.
Actively seeks new knowledge of methods for data management and analysis to increase quality and compliance measures.
Oversees maintenance and expansion of QM databases to meet the growing needs of the Agency.
Coordinates migration and import of data from stand-alone databases to the Client Central system, and/or make recommendations regarding coordination of data from disparate systems.
Coordinates with the Security and Privacy Officers to support the security, and confidentiality of client-related data.
Works with QM staff and department managers to support workflow and output of data collection processes and reporting systems.
Prepares monthly, quarterly, annual and as-needed aggregate and trend reports related to program, department and agency quality and outcomes data.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree required in Public Health, Statistics, Computer Science or a similar discipline with three to five years’ experience managing databases and conducting data analysis. Master’s Degree preferred.
Knowledge:
Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Access, Excel, SQL, Outlook, Crystal Reports, and PowerPoint.
Skills and Abilities:
Advanced skills in statistical analysis of healthcare data, performance measurement, business intelligence and evaluation.
Database management skills, specifically Microsoft Access, SQL server, or comparable environment.
Must be comfortable formulating and implementing statistical analysis plans of moderate complexity.
Ability to work independently and to set priorities while managing several projects simultaneously; strong attention to detail is essential.

Data Analyst/Sr Data Analyst
At Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as an Agile team within a Fortune 100 company, we are on the front edge of an IT transformation for how people work and deliver solutions.

Overview:
This is a provisional appointment.

Brief Job Description (essential functions of the job):

The Department of Innovation and Technology seeks a Data and Performance Analyst to join the Citywide Analytics Team.

The Citywide Analytics Team’s mission is to use data to improve quality of life and to enhance government operations in the City of Boston. By combining modern data analysis and visualizations with a deeply engaged approach to performance improvement and change management, the team works with departments across the City to solve challenging problems, build a more effective government, and deliver better outcomes for people who live and work in Boston. You can learn more about our team, check out our “Year In Review” reports, and see examples of our projects at http://boston.gov/analytics.

Under the direction and guidance of the Analytics Team leadership, the Data and Performance Analyst will be an essential member of the Citywide Analytics Team. The Analyst's work will directly contribute to operational and technical improvements throughout the City of Boston.
Responsibilities:
Leads and supports the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of ongoing reports, analyses, dashboards, and metrics for key operations and decision making for City departments. Serves as a resource and content expert for the department in this process.
Proactively builds and maintains positive and effective relationships with Departments. Works with Departments to analyze results, forecast current and future needs, assess performance and evaluate strategic opportunities.
Communicates with and presenting to executive leadership project results and findings.
Works with the team’s data engineers and other departments in the development of data warehouses and other data sources to support managerial and business intelligence reporting needs.
Assembles, manipulates and/or formats data and/or reports using various software applications such as desktop tools, spreadsheets, report writing software, statistical software, graphical presentation tools, and business intelligence (BI) applications.
Performs related work as required.
Minimum Entrance Qualifications:
A minimum of two (2) years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in business or public administration, program management or related field, in work that included data analysis, reporting, dashboarding, mapping, and/or visualization using software and languages such as Python, R, SQL, ArcGIS, or Tableau.
Experience in a government setting preferred.
A bachelor’s degree in business, public policy or administration, economics, computer science, or another STEM field is preferred and may be substituted for two years of the required experience
Must be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and react to problems quickly.
Must be able to translate concepts and directions into practical solutions.
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and Google Apps (Docs, Sheets, and slides) strongly preferred.
Ability to exercise good judgment and focus on details as required by the job.
Ability to manage simultaneous assignments while maintaining a critical attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to work on diverse teams and experience building strong relationships across a range of functional areas and seniority levels.
Proven verbal and written communication skills.
Proven organizational and project management skills.

BOSTON RESIDENCY REQUIRED.

job_title: Special Programs Coordinator: Data Analyst in Nursing
summary:
About Berkshire Community College:
Berkshire Community College (BCC) has the distinction of being the first community college established in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Nestled in the scenic Berkshire Hills, our nearly 2,000 students have access to a wide range of career and transfer programs on our newly renovated campus. Occupying a scenic 180-acre property, just minutes from downtown Pittsfield, Massachusetts, BCC provides students from a broad range of cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds with an intimate learning environment, small class sizes, and much opportunity for interaction with faculty. Berkshire County was home to many forward-thinking historic figures including, W.E.B. DuBois, Susan B. Anthony, and Elizabeth (Mumbet) Freeman, all of whom were pioneers of social justice. The Berkshires contain both rural and urban elements, combining a beautiful natural environment with world class museums and other cultural opportunities. Pittsfield and Berkshire County continue to evolve, with immigrants from over 70 countries now calling the Berkshires their home. BCC seeks to recruit diverse employees who embrace, as well as demonstrate, a commitment to diversity and inclusion and whose experiences and perspectives model the opportunities and success derived from a college education.

Job Description:
Position Summary: Reporting to the Director of Nursing, the Data Analyst is responsible for systematizing data management, recording active data, and working with nursing faculty and staff to trend data as required by the systematic evaluation plan. Data points include, but are not restricted to, those related to students (e.g., immunization, grades, attendance records), faculty (e.g., certifications, insurance, credentials), clinical coursework (e.g., Clinical Evaluation Tool Data), and course assessments (e.g., test and quiz grades, project grades)

Further responsibilities include support of the Nurse Administrator in ensuring compliance with the regulatory and accreditation standards of the Massachusetts Board of Registration in Nursing (MABORN) and the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN) (244 CMR: 6.04 MABORN/Standards 1-6 ACEN), respectively.

Essential Functions:
Manage information required for regulatory compliance
Work collaboratively with faculty to record student data
Manage student and faculty records
Use software/design systems for tracking program information
In collaboration with Institutional Effectiveness, design and distribute surveys for current students, alumni, and health care partners

Requirements:
Required Qualifications: Associate Degree in Nursing. RN designation in MA. Previous experience in Nursing Education

Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's or above in Nursing. Administrative Experience in Nursing or Nursing Education.

Additional Information:
Source of Funding: State funded

Salary: $51,719 - $52,539 w/ benefits (per MCCC contract)

Area of Assignment: Academic Affairs- Nursing

Supervisor: Dean of Nursing

Anticipated Start Date: January 2020

BCC is committed to providing an inclusive learning and working environment that values the diverse backgrounds of all people and encourages applications from individuals whose experiences and perspectives model the opportunities and success derived from a college education.

Berkshire Community College is an affirmative action/equal opportunity institution and does not discriminate on basis of race, creed, religion, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, genetic information, maternity leave, military service, and national origin in its education programs or employment. All inquiries concerning application of the above should be directed to Melissa Loiodice, Director of Human Resources, Affirmative Action Officer, and Coordinator of Title IX and Section 504, at 413-499-4660, ext. 1022, Susan B. Anthony Annex Building, Room A19.

Application Instructions:
Application Procedures: To apply, please submit cover letter, resume, and names and telephone numbers of three current professional references by visiting the employment section of our website at www.berkshirecc.edu/employment.

Application Closing Date: November 15, 2019.

URL: www.berkshirecc.edu/about-bcc/employment-opportunities/index.php

Advance your Career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company
Principal Data Strategy Analyst
Do you want to apply your strategic thinking towards more evolutionary technology? Do you want to help the right people focus on the right opportunities when it comes to data? If the answers are “yes” – then come join our team!
The Principal Analyst, Data Strategy for the Data Office will play a critical role in developing the data strategy and roadmap. The Data Office is dedicated to Liberty’s Global Retail Markets, which is the biggest business unit of Liberty Mutual. This new office was created in 2018 as part of our overall shift to a streamlined and centralized data model. In this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with U.S. business and technical partners to understand their pain points, discuss solutions, develop roadmaps, and influence prioritization of data initiatives that enable the business to make faster and more accurate decisions, based on measures of success.

Responsibilities:
Strategy & Planning - Assist in the creation of data strategy and support planning across all U.S. personal lines portfolios at Liberty Mutual.

Research - Conduct research on emerging data and technology trends to influence and evolve the data strategy roadmap.
Collaboration - Partner with technology and data teams to surface those problems and discuss and ideate on possible approaches to solve them. Demonstrate a flexible, Agile mindset to collaborate and drive results.
Messaging and Buy-In - Be a compelling storyteller to gain support on the strategy by delivering effective presentations to a senior audience. Socialize ideas and rapidly iterate on feedback to ensure the maximum buy-in and impact of the strategic message.

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or relevant work experience in a quantitative discipline required.
MBA or similar advanced degree preferred.
5+ years in management consulting, corporate strategy or strategic planning roles preferred.
Candidate should have strong written and oral communication skills with experience communicating recommendations.

The mission of MassHealth is to improve the health outcomes of our diverse members, their families and their communities by providing access to integrated health care services that sustainably promote health, well-being, independence and quality of life.

Massachusetts’ Office of Medicaid (MassHealth) is looking for an exceptional Full-Time Healthcare Data Analyst to join the Office of Analytics. The MassHealth Analytics team produces quantitative and qualitative analyses to inform business decisions at MassHealth. The selected candidate will work for the MassHealth Office of Analytics, reporting to the Manager of Analytics, and will collaborate closely with other MassHealth units to identify analytic questions and key timelines.

The Healthcare Data Analyst will determine the appropriate data elements to use for reporting on measures for healthcare utilization and other measures, as well as create the programs for provider-level reporting of these measures. In addition, the data analyst will conduct data manipulation and in-depth analysis of complex health care data using programming languages such as SAS and SQL to produce analyses on costs, utilization, and outcomes. The Healthcare Data Analyst will have an opportunity to inform business decisions through analyses, so the ideal candidate will have an interest and understanding of MassHealth programs in addition to being a strong coder.

This position will be located in Quincy, MA.

Duties and Responsibilities (these duties are a general summary and not all inclusive):
Identify data elements for monitoring of utilization and trends in MassHealth administrative claims data and in provider-generated data sets
Conduct analyses and produce standard reports using healthcare claims data which support the development, implementation, and monitoring of contraceptive use as well as other MassHealth programs.
Build data and analytic tools such as dashboards to support analyses.
Analyze, interpret, and present information from multiple data sources utilizing a broad array of technology resources (Cognos, SAS, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, SQL, etc.).
Manage and prioritize analytic requests from several departments within MassHealth.
Liaise with and manage Data Warehouse staff to build tools that require Data Warehouse development staff, and ensure that development timelines crucial to program operations are met.
Serve as a subject matter expert for MassHealth data, providing insight into the capabilities and limitations of MassHealth data to members of program teams.
Liaise with external stakeholders on outward-facing data initiatives to provide basic technical assistance and solicit feedback.
Effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders and adapt aspects of the program accordingly.
Manage a multitude of complex tasks simultaneously, including prioritizing various tasks, analyzing and evaluating policy and program issues and ensuring that tasks are brought to final completion.
Develop a working, integrated knowledge of program policy through the lens of operations and communicate this to internal and external parties.
Plan, organize, and direct project team meetings.
Other duties as assigned.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least two years of work experience in a healthcare analytic or data management environment.
Experience in SAS and/or SQL, ACCESS, and other data manipulation tools.
Experience working with Health care administrative data and complex healthcare databases.
Experience leading project-based teams on complex, long-term initiatives. Experience working with actuaries, clinicians, health policy experts, and other subject matter experts.
Masters’ degree in a public policy, public administration, economics, health care administration, epidemiology, statistics, or a related field.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and partners.
Ability to work with technical staff, including programming staff and analytic contractors.
Strong analytical, organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills.
Knowledge of the Massachusetts health care industry and market dynamics.
Ability to prioritize numerous tasks, and to work under time constraints.
Special Requirements:

Based on assignment, possession of a current and valid Massachusetts Class D Motor Vehicle Operator’s license or the equivalent from another state may be required.


Pre-Offer Process:

A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori and click on "Information for Job Applicants".

Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions, please the contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.


Qualifications

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS:

Applicants must have at least (A) three years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in business administration, health care planning or administration, public health policy or administration, human services policy analysis or administration or economics, the major duties of which include financial analysis of costs, expenses and revenue and/or the development, implementation and monitoring of financial reimbursement systems, or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.

Substitutions:

I. A Bachelor's degree with a major in health care administration, hospital administration, public health or health services administration, accounting, business administration, business management, public policy, public administration or economics may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required experience.*

Job Title: Data Analyst Director II
Business Unit: Administration
Department: Fiscal 352
Reports to: Chief Executive Officer
FLSA: Non-Exempt
Classification: Regular Full-time 35 hours
Grade Level: 15/16
Salary Range: $65,000 $100,000 commensurate with experience
JOB DESCRIPTION
Summary/Objective
The Data Analyst Director will help to lead Boston Senior Home Care s in a continuously changing social service and healthcare industry that relies on technology and data as key factors to success.
BSHC has put plans in motion, including working with an outside data firm, to create a data-driven, organization, reshaping its operations so its teams can deliver the outcomes demanded by its clients, payers and partners, while also effectively demonstrating value and improving efficiencies.
The Data Analyst Director is primarily responsible for providing recurring monthly reports, on demand data reports and data analysis supporting Boston Senior Home Care BSHC's internal customers. Internal customers are primarily the Senior Management team, Administrative Managers and Directors. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for determining when a supervisor or others should be consulted, when data appears erroneous or showing significant fluctuations. The Individual is responsible for timely production and dissemination of accurate reports, data and management information. This Individual will be responsible for project-based analysis and reporting data projects and executive Ad doc report requests.
Essential Functions:
Essential Job functions: Duties ____1__ through ___6__are designated as ADA Essential Functions and must be performed in this job. All other job duties are secondary functions
The main responsibilities of the Report Data Analyst Director include:
Collaborate with external consulting firm to define, design and operationalize reports and dashboards which deliver actionable data and measures to senior management, directors, managers and case managers; envision and document future-state workflows which align with modern payment models and performance measures;
Partner with department Chiefs and Directors to identify opportunities to use data to improve business processes and operations.
Manage the documentation of business processes, workflows and data maps.
Responsible for synchronizing data across multiple applications throughout the organization in order to create data dashboards
Conduct data analysis, design and develop standardized management reporting tools
Conduct ongoing analysis of data for Senior Management team, Administrative Managers and Directors.
Review reports prior to dissemination for accuracy and identification of data showing significant fluctuations. Significant should be reported to management.
Conduct project based data analysis and ad-hoc reporting.
Conduct training and implementation of the reporting system
Work with staff within the organization who run reports and work with database.
Competencies:
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task.
Solutions-oriented problem solver.
Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills.
Proficient in Microsoft SQL Server Development T-SQL, DTS.
Must have knowledge of relational databases design and tuning.
Proficient in report documentation and auditing procedures.
Must be detail oriented, self-starter and statistical savvy.
Ability to communicate complex information in simple terms.
Excellent communication oral and written and interpersonal skills.
Ability to handle multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Supervisory Responsibility:
This position currently has no position has no supervisory responsibilities. This may change as the data development evolves.
Work Environment:
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Travel
This position does not require travel.
Required/Preferred Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in relevant field.
Five years of experience in a similar role and a non-profit industry.
Additional Eligibility Qualifications
None required for this position.
Work Authorization/Security Clearance
Must clear CORI background check.
AAP/EEO Statement
Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Male/Female/Veteran/Disabled Boston Senior Home Care affirms and supports diversity and inclusion in our workforce.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

ABOUT DTA


The Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) assists and empowers low-income individuals and families to meet their basic needs, improve their quality of life, and achieve long term economic self-sufficiency. DTA serves one in eight residents of the Commonwealth with direct economic assistance (cash benefits) and food assistance (SNAP benefits), as well as workforce training opportunities.

This is a provisional appointment.

POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking qualified applicants for the position of Senior Data Analyst. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for using technical expertise to analyze policy, financial, and operational data from a wide range of data sets to produce informed policy decisions; ensuring data integrity and promoting transparency; using primary research and statistical methods to inform analyses; and compiling and communicating findings to non-technical leadership to minimize anecdotal responses in favor of data-driven solutions. The duties will include but are not limited to:
Assist with the development and implementation of various monitoring reports for DTA Management. Performs on-demand report generation, ad-hoc queries and analytic tasks.
Write and revise complex SQL queries using optimization design patterns to minimize negative impact to database resources.
Extract data using TOAD, Cognos Analytics, and Tableau to provide data and data analysis for internal and external stakeholders.
Provide analytical support to time sensitive projects and operations changes, working directly with senior leadership.
Apply basic and intermediate statistical methods to validate data and develop statistical models Develop systems and strategies for utilizing internal and external databases and other data sources for policy, program and procedure evaluation.
Become a subject matter expert on all program metrics, data sets and trends.
Deconstruct and evaluate current Agency functions and recommend, implement and evaluate changes by generating analytic reports.
End-to-end validation using Oracle SQL, Python, and Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, aggregate functions, IF statements) to ensure comprehensive data integrity.
Proficient in advanced data modeling, including multiple regression techniques, have experience with test design and execution, and experience with analytic surveying techniques
Identification of the correct data, analysis, or approach to translate complex business problems into insights and actionable recommendations
Deduce meaning of analyses and distribute the information back to senior level staff. Identify trends and patterns that can inform predictive analytics.
Assume independent responsibility for tasks given to the analyst by their manager. Demonstrate ability to research and understand previously unknown subject matter to accomplish the task.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge and expertise in practical statistical sampling theory and application, data collection and analysis. methodologies, and electronic data processing applications.
Knowledge of statistical software to conduct various analysis
At least four years of professional experience using relational database tools to extract data and turn that data into an analytical form (i.e. reports, charts, graphs)
Advanced knowledge of Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, LOOKUP formulas), SQL and data visualization skills (Tableau, Cognos), ODBC sources, Oracle, SAS, and/or Toad
Working knowledge of R and/or Python
Working knowledge of the DTA public assistance programs (TANF/TAFDC, EAEDC, SNAP, employment services) and BEACON data warehouse
Knowledge of federal and state laws and regulations governing the functions of the agency
Ability to analyze and determine the applicability of data, draw meaningful conclusions and make appropriate recommendations
Ability to promote and support data improvement, innovation, communication and integration efforts
Detail-oriented and have a sense of urgency; self-starters who possess the intellectual curiosity to be a systematic problem solver
Knowledge of Performance Management with the ability to design and implement data collection, research, evaluation, quality management and accountability processes
Ability to distill complex data into succinct reports (in a manner appropriate and comprehensible to various audiences) leading to conclusions, recommendations and/or action items
Knowledge of project management theory and practice with the ability to design and manage process for coordinating the prioritization of projects; ability to track the progress of each project and identify project improvement opportunities and strategies
Skilled in problem solving, consensus building and team building with the ability to manage a number of projects simultaneously to successful completion
Knowledge of dashboard creation and production
Knowledge of program improvement, innovation and integration strategies
Ability to present facts, data, and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Ability to communicate in writing and orally with superiors and subordinates, with the public and state officials
Ability to mediate conflicts, coordinate competing interests, work under time constraints, and adjust to varying or changing situations to meet emergency or changing program requirements
Ability to exercise discretion in handling confidential information
Ability to exercise sound judgment


Pre-Offer Process:
A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori and click on "Information for Job Applicants".

Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines.

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions, please contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.

Qualifications

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

Minimum Entrance Requirements:

Applicants must have at least (A) five years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in electronic data processing, of which (B) at least three years must have been in work in which the major duties included computer systems analysis, or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.

SUBSTITUTIONS:

I. An Associate's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

II. A Bachelor's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*

III. A Graduate degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*

IV. A diploma for completion of a two year full-time, or equivalent part-time, program in a recognized non-degree granting business or vocational/technical school above the high school level with a major in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

V. An official transcript from a recognized business or vocational/ technical school as evidence of completion of a program consisting of at least 650 hours of instruction in the field of computer programming maybe substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

VI. Graduation from the data processing course of a recognized vocational/technical high school may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.

Education toward such a degree or diploma will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.
NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for more than two years of the required (A) experience.

NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for the three years of the required (B) experience.

Special Requirements: None.

An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

job_title: Data Solutions Analyst / Sr Data Solutions Analyst
summary:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance- A Fortune 100 Company!

Do you want to leverage your creative and technical skills in a business environment? Do you have an eye for design? Want to be part of an innovative culture? Are you looking for a position with potential for growth and advancement? If any of these apply to you – come join our team!

As a Business Intelligence analyst and developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining business intelligence solutions to support key strategic and operational initiatives within Liberty Mutual’s Business Lines Distribution & Service Insights organization. This position will require working collaboratively with technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure end-user needs for business intelligence solutions are met.

This is a range posting, meaning we can hire someone as either a Data Solutions Analyst or a Sr. Data Solutions Analyst depending on skills and experience. The preferred office location is Boston MA with secondary office locations in Dover NH, Plano TX, Seattle, WA, Indianapolis, IN, Fairfield, OH or Wausau, WI. We are also open to a working remote scenario.
 Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain solutions that leverage Best-in-Class intelligence design capabilities
Assists in the design and development data solutions that enable effective self-service data consumption and can describe their value to the customer.
Improve accessibility to data via data aggregation, effective visualization and navigation improvements
Develop re-usable tools and assets to support automation, reporting and analytics initiatives
Produce accurate, consistent and timely visualizations by extracting information from various applications and systems, manipulating data and leveraging business intelligence tools to develop user-friendly outputs
Effectively source data into business intelligence tools to enable visualizations
Automate existing reporting and establish business intelligence best practices
Establish detailed documentation for all visualizations and technical solutions
Identify reporting and data processes that are inefficient and drive change that will lead to measurable gains in data quality and processing time
Work in partnership with other groups to develop automated visualizations in the most effective medium
Provide appropriate communication to stakeholders, including providing customer support for existing tools (ex: issues, questions, enhancements)
Conduct infrastructure design work efforts using a variety of analytical tools
Assists in the maintenance of proof-of-concepts and prototype solutions and assists in any assessment of their viability and scalability, with partnership from IT. Working with IT, assists in building robust systems focusing on long-term and ongoing maintenance and support.
Applies a basic knowledge of the principles of metadata, lineage, business definitions, compliance, and data security to project work.
Participate in special projects as required

Qualifications:
Strong written and oral communication skills required.
1-2 years’ experience in coding for data management, data warehousing, or other data environments, including, but not limited to, working in NoSQL implementation, ETL, Java, scripting languages (Python, Perl, Shell), and the Hadoop stack.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline preferred.
Master`s in same or related disciplines strongly preferred.
Knowledge of data architecture concepts, querying and data sourcing. Knowledge of SAS, MicroStrategy or similar database tools preferred
1+ years programming experience in at least 1 of the following: Java, Python, C++ or similar language preferred
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, HDFS, Map Reduce, Hive, Pig preferred. Highly developed negotiation, consensus building & influencing skills, facilitation and the adaptability to respond to change quickly. Ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization and work both as a member of an Agile team and independently as required
Effective analytical/problem solving and research skills
Ability to manage tasks/projects with aggressive deadlines/time-sensitivity

Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.

We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

job_title: Data Analyst, HSI STEM Grant Project, Part-time - Springfield Technical Community College
summary:
Location: Springfield, MA Category: Administrative and Professional Posted On: Mon Sep 9 2019 Job Description:
GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES:
The Data Analyst will be a part of the team of HSI STEM Grant Project staff. Under the supervision of the HSI STEM Activity Director, the Data Analyst will be responsible for the data collection, analysis, and reporting of key metrics related to all HSI STEM initiatives through Springfield Technical Community College, producing reports for the US Department of Education and other grant-related needs.
Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Management of HSI STEM participants' data collection and tracking systems.
Assist the Activity Director, and on-campus staff in development and coordination of HSI STEM assessment and evaluation activities.
Identification and/or development of assessment instruments for gathering appropriate qualitative data required for assessing project activities.
Collection, analysis, and reporting of HSI STEM Project participant data, including demographic information, enrollment, and retention and completion rates.
Identification and manipulation of available data; query writing if necessary.
Help and advise administrators in the effective utilization of data from analyses.
Collaboration across departments for assessment and use of relevant project data.
Other duties as assigned by the HSI STEM Activity Director.

Job Requirements:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required in Social or Behavioral Sciences, Education, Public Policy, or similar field.
One to three years professional experience in Institutional Research, Social or Behavioral Science research, or Higher Education (or equivalent work experience).
Highly proficient with MS Excel and Access required, with a demonstrated ability to manage complex datasets.
Knowledge of standard statistical and qualitative methodologies (i.e., basic research design and methods, descriptive and inferential statistics, and other generally-accepted analysis approaches).
Demonstrated experience with qualitative and quantitative data collection, management, analysis, and interpretation.
Ability to combine multiple data sources to produce analytical reports.
Must have demonstrated ability to produce reports.
Demonstrated ability with one or more of the following statistical software packages: SPSS (preferred), SAS, STATA, or R.
Familiarity with descriptive statistics.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to communicate to non-technical audiences
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
Attention to detail.
A commitment to working in a culturally diverse, urban community college.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree in Social or Behavioral Sciences, Education, Public Policy, or similar field or relevant graduate coursework preferred.
Experience with higher education data (cohort identification, program completions, retention rates, transfer rates, longitudinal tracking).
Experience with and knowledge of student information and administrative computing systems.
Working knowledge of data visualization software (e.g., Tableau)
WORKING CONDITIIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Use office equipment and computer keyboards requiring eye-hand coordination and finger dexterity. Ability to occasionally lift 25 lbs. Balancing, crouching, grasping, pulling, reaching and stooping may also be required.

SALARY: $30.00 hourly
BENEFITS: No
WORK SCHEDULE: 18.5 hours/week (flexible schedule)

Finalist(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment screening as a condition of employment.

The mission of MassHealth is to improve the health outcomes of our diverse members, their families and their communities by providing access to integrated health care services that sustainably promote health, well-being, independence and quality of life.

Massachusetts’ Office of Medicaid (MassHealth) is looking for an exceptional Full-Time Healthcare Data Analyst to join the Office of Analytics. The MassHealth Analytics team produces quantitative and qualitative analyses to inform business decisions at MassHealth. The selected candidate will work for the MassHealth Office of Analytics, reporting to the Manager of Analytics, and will collaborate closely with other MassHealth units to identify analytic questions and key timelines.

The Healthcare Data Analyst will determine the appropriate data elements to use for reporting on measures for healthcare utilization and other measures, as well as create the programs for provider-level reporting of these measures. In addition, the data analyst will conduct data manipulation and in-depth analysis of complex health care data using programming languages such as SAS and SQL to produce analyses on costs, utilization, and outcomes. The Healthcare Data Analyst will have an opportunity to inform business decisions through analyses, so the ideal candidate will have an interest and understanding of MassHealth programs in addition to being a strong coder.

This position will be located in Quincy, MA.

Duties and Responsibilities (these duties are a general summary and not all inclusive):
Identify data elements for monitoring of utilization and trends in MassHealth administrative claims data and in provider-generated data sets
Conduct analyses and produce standard reports using healthcare claims data which support the development, implementation, and monitoring of contraceptive use as well as other MassHealth programs.
Build data and analytic tools such as dashboards to support analyses.
Analyze, interpret, and present information from multiple data sources utilizing a broad array of technology resources (Cognos, SAS, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, SQL, etc.).
Manage and prioritize analytic requests from several departments within MassHealth.
Liaise with and manage Data Warehouse staff to build tools that require Data Warehouse development staff, and ensure that development timelines crucial to program operations are met.
Serve as a subject matter expert for MassHealth data, providing insight into the capabilities and limitations of MassHealth data to members of program teams.
Liaise with external stakeholders on outward-facing data initiatives to provide basic technical assistance and solicit feedback.
Effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders and adapt aspects of the program accordingly.
Manage a multitude of complex tasks simultaneously, including prioritizing various tasks, analyzing and evaluating policy and program issues and ensuring that tasks are brought to final completion.
Develop a working, integrated knowledge of program policy through the lens of operations and communicate this to internal and external parties.
Plan, organize, and direct project team meetings.
Other duties as assigned.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least two years of work experience in a healthcare analytic or data management environment.
Experience in SAS and/or SQL, ACCESS, and other data manipulation tools.
Experience working with Health care administrative data and complex healthcare databases.
Experience leading project-based teams on complex, long-term initiatives. Experience working with actuaries, clinicians, health policy experts, and other subject matter experts.
Masters’ degree in a public policy, public administration, economics, health care administration, epidemiology, statistics, or a related field.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with a range of stakeholders and partners.
Ability to work with technical staff, including programming staff and analytic contractors.
Strong analytical, organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills.
Knowledge of the Massachusetts health care industry and market dynamics.
Ability to prioritize numerous tasks, and to work under time constraints.
Special Requirements:

Based on assignment, possession of a current and valid Massachusetts Class D Motor Vehicle Operator’s license or the equivalent from another state may be required.


Pre-Offer Process:

A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori and click on "Information for Job Applicants".

Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions, please the contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.


Qualifications

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS:

Applicants must have at least (A) three years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in business administration, health care planning or administration, public health policy or administration, human services policy analysis or administration or economics, the major duties of which include financial analysis of costs, expenses and revenue and/or the development, implementation and monitoring of financial reimbursement systems, or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.

Substitutions:

I. A Bachelor's degree with a major in health care administration, hospital administration, public health or health services administration, accounting, business administration, business management, public policy, public administration or economics may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required experience.*

II. A Graduate degree with a major in health care administration, hospital administration, public health or health services administration, accounting, business administration, business management, public policy, public administration or economics may be substituted for the required experience.

Education toward such a degree will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.

Job Title
Assistant Research Scientist
Agency
Texas A&M University Health Science Center
Department
Biomedical Sciences
Proposed Minimum Salary
$23.95 hourly
Job Location
Dallas, Texas
Job Type
Temporary/Casual Staff (Fixed Term)
Job Description
What we believe
Texas A&M University is committed to enriching the learning and working environment for all visitors, students, faculty, and staff by promoting a culture that embraces inclusion, diversity, equity, and accountability. Diverse perspectives, talents and identities are vital to accomplishing our mission and living our core values .”
Who we are
As one of the fastest-growing academic health centers in the nation, the Texas A&M University Health Science Center encompasses five colleges and numerous centers and institutes working together to improve health through transformative education, innovative research and team-based health care delivery.
A part of the Texas A&M University Health Science Center, Texas A&M College of Dentistry in Dallas was founded in 1905 and is a nationally recognized center for oral health sciences education, research, specialized patient care and continuing dental education.
What we want
The College of Dentistry is looking for an Assistant Research Scientist to serve as a member of the research team. We desire an individual who subscribes to and supports our commitment as stated above. The successful applicant will bring an expert level of bone biology and oral biology experience to the position and understand the demands of supporting executives in a fast-paced environment. This person must be professional, enjoy working in a high-volume environment and be able to apply strong organizational skills while being flexible in their daily routine. If this is you, we invite you to apply to become a member of our team.
Job Summary:
The candidate will work on projects of tooth and limb development. Experimental skills such as in situ hybridization, immunofluorescent staining, Western blotting and tissue dissection under stereoscope are required. Experience in scRNA-Seq and experimental mice are preferred.
Required Education and Experience:
Appropriate doctoral degree and relevant professional experience.
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to multi-task and work cooperatively with others.
Ability to perform all tasks and job responsibilities safely without injury to self and others in compliance with A&M System and HSC guidelines
Ability to learn and understand research principles, techniques and communicate with all levels of personnel.
Computer software skills.
Preferred Education and Experience:
Lab experience such as Western Blot, cell culture, DNA electrophoresis and RNA techniques, IHC and IF, genotyping etc.
Experience in bone biology and oral biology research.
Experience working with diverse individuals and communities
Responsibilities:
General Laboratory Duties -
Animal Duties - Genetic animal breeding, genotyping, phenotype characterization, PCR and sequencing.
Proteins/Immunology - chromatography, immunohistochemistry, western blot/electrophoresis, second messenger signaling assays.
Cut bone and tooth sections, handle tissue procession, imaging use - multiple microscopes (confocal, electronic microscope) tail PCR. Perform other duties as assigned.
Instructions to Applicants: Applications received by Texas A&M University must either have all job application data entered or a resume attached. Failure to provide all job application data or a complete resume could result in an invalid submission and a rejected application. We encourage all applicants to upload a resume or use a LinkedIn profile to pre-populate the online application.
Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Veterans/Disability Employer committed to diversity.
All positions are security-sensitive. Applicants are subject to a criminal history investigation, and employment is contingent upon the institution’s verification of credentials and/or other information required by the institution’s procedures, including the completion of the criminal history check.

job_title: RESEARCH SCIENTIST - DR. KAPIL N. BHALLA'S LABORATORY
summary:
Dr. Kapil N. Bhalla is currently seeking a Senior Research Scientist who will be responsible for conducting research in his NIH-funded laboratory. The focus of the basic and translational research in this laboratory includes the biology and developmental therapeutics related to epigenetic mechanisms involving histone deacetylases, methyltransferases and demethylases, BET proteins, as well as the chaperone biology of heat shock proteins and their cancer relevant client proteins regulating cell growth, differentiation and survival of the human leukemia stem/progenitor cells. The qualified candidate must possess a Ph.D. in Biology, Biological Sciences, Life Sciences or related field and a keen interest and experience in cancer research. The candidate must have completed at least a 3 year Post-doctoral fellowship in an area relevant to the focus of research in Dr. Bhalla's laboratory. The qualified candidate must have the ability to troubleshoot in the design and conduct of the laboratory studies. Experience in molecular studies involving gene transfection, analysis of gene expression through QPCR, microarrays, immunoblots and flow cytometry, as well as experience in chromatin immunoprecipitation studies, evaluation of protein biochemistry with 2D gels and the yeast-two-hybrid system, and tissue culture techniques is required. Experience in the ability to utilize CRISPR technology for gene editing and to utilize confocal microscopy for molecular imaging is highly desired. Experience in xenograft and genetically-engineered animal models of cancer and/or leukemia, and confocal microscopy is also desired. An outstanding research environment, new laboratory and core facilities are provided.

The salary range is: min-$53,200, mid-$66,500 and max-$79,800.

KEY FUNCTIONS

Research Design and implementation
Plans, organizes, coordinates, directs and conducts scientific research projects. Develops and maintains standard procedures and protocols to ensure the quality and integrity of the procedures performed. Coordinates with other investigators to provide appropriate support on analytical techniques. Maintains detailed experimental records, evaluates resulting research data, and presents findings to physicians and/or professional groups.

Data Analysis
Analyzes and evaluates research data and revises techniques and approaches to work problems. Works with the Principal Investigator on projects in the area of biomarker development and leukemia biology. Participates in adopting new techniques and learning new skills to enhance research efforts.

Lab Development/Publications
Supervises, mentors, and counsels trainees and other laboratory personnel with respect to proper laboratory techniques, the use of laboratory equipment and safety procedures. Publications/Manuscripts and Presentations. Contributes to manuscripts and prepares documents for publication. Compiles, writes, and submits reports to superior. Presents results at national meetings.

Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION

Required: PhD in one of the natural sciences or related field or Medical degree.

EXPERIENCE
Required: With PhD, no experience required. With Medical degree, two years of experience in experimental or scientific work.

Preferred: With PhD must have completed at least a 3 year Post-doctoral fellowship in an area relevant to the focus of research in Dr. Bhalla's laboratory.

It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html
